loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a mother who engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 36 years old, married, and has only one child. She aspires to make her business profitable in order earn a higher income. 

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to access an additional capital of PHP32,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise. 

She is hoping that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a 46-year-old woman from Punta Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children.  Having started her fishing business from a mere capital of Php 4,000, she is coping well with the challenges of her business.  Her husband, who is also a fisherman, is very supportive in taking care of their business. They bring their catch to the nearest market and even sell it around their barangay. The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand. 

She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan of Php 50,000 to additionally capitalize her business.  Cristy envisions acquiring an additional fishing boat.

She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future.  

Cristy dreams also of renovating their little house, and to start saving now for the education of their children.

loans.use: Purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 51 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married, with five children. 

Lucila has a shop that sells different kinds of products from Avon, MSE and Natasha; she does direct selling. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan to purchase more stocks of products to increase sales. Lucila has been a member of PMPC for six years. 

In the future, Lucila hopes to have more clients to buy her products.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon, MSE and Natasha products

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie is a businesswoman from Sindagan, ZDN. She is 54 years old, married, and has an expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store, and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Lynie is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. 

Now she applied a loan to buy flour, biscuits, drinks, etc to sustain the demands of the customers. 

Lynie continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: To buy flour, biscuits, drinks, etc to sustain the demands of the customers

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rosendo Antonio

texts.es:
Rosendo un hombre de 44 años de edad que no solo demuestra fortaleza en su físico, sino en su toma de decisiones, forma de actuar y trabajar, es un hombre honrado muy correcto y un trabajador incasable que se dedica a la agricultora y con ello puede mantener a su numerosa familia conformada por su pareja y sus 5 hijos 3 varones de 7, 10, 9 años de edad y dos mujeres de 6 y 23 años de edad.
Rosendo quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos de mantenimientos de cultivos y agradece que una entidad micro-financiera le de la mano a personas que habitan en sectores donde muy difícilmente alguien los auxilia. 
Con el crédito comprara abonos y fertilizantes para mantener sus cultivos y esperar una numerosa cosecha que apoye la educación y alimentación de sus hijos que es su prioridad.
texts.en:
Rosendo is a 44-year-old man who not only shows physical strength, but also strength in his decision-making and his way of being and working. He is an honest and very courteous man and a tireless worker who works in agriculture and with this is able to support his large family made up of his partner and their 5 children, 3 males ages 7, 10 and 9 years old, and two females ages 6 and 23 years old.

Roseando wants to ask for a loan to purchase supplies to maintain his crops and is grateful that a microfinance institution gives a hand to people who live in the areas where it is very difficult to find someone to help them.

With the loan, he will purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his crops and to expect a large harvest that will support his children's education and nutrition, who are his priority.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain his crops such as manure and fertilizer. He is the father of 5 children and only has his land for subsistence.

loans.name: Glenis

texts.es: Glenis, domiciliada en el municipio de Soledad, inició su negocio ofreciendo mercancías económicas y detalles a sus vecinos y referidos. En vista de que en su negocio se incrementaron los pedidos gracias a su excelente servicio, decidió ampliar el portafolio de sus productos y  poco a poco  incorporó útiles de papelería, cosméticos, perfumes, ropa, calzado entre otros. Logró la fidelización de clientes, razón por la que necesitó aplicarle capital a su negocio, para lograr cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, es así como está aplicando su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará mercancías varias según pedidos de sus clientes como ropa calzado, cosméticos, perfumes y detalles de ocasión.  Este negocio tiene 10 años de estar en funcionamiento, se inició en el año 2004, la señora Glenis trabaja 10 horas diarias en él, ha logrado surgir gracias a su empeño y a la confianza que han depositado sus proveedores los cuales le dan crédito y también realiza sus compras de contado; así mismo ella brinda facilidad de pago a sus clientes por lo que le es necesario manejar un buen flujo de caja para cumplir con sus obligaciones financieras.  Gladis es una mujer casada de 47 años de edad y junto con su esposo desean conseguir una casa propia.
texts.en: Glenis, who lives in the municipality of Soledad, began her business offering bargain merchandise and small items to her neighbors and people referred to her. In light of the fact that her business's orders increased, thanks to her excellent service, she decided to expand her portfolio of products and little by little incorporated paper goods, cosmetics, perfumes, clothing, and footwear, among others. She managed to gain a loyal customer base, so she needed to apply capital to her business to be able to meet the needs of her customers. So, she is applying for her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a variety of merchandise according to her customers' orders such as clothing, footwear, cosmetics, perfumes and small items. This business has been operating for 10 years, it opened in 2004. Glenis works 10 hours a day in it, and has it managed to succeed thanks to her efforts, and to the confidence that her suppliers have put in her since they give her credit and also she makes her purchases with cash. In the same way, she offers the ease of payment to her customers, so it is necessary to have a good cash flow to cover her financial obligations. Glenis is a married woman, 47 years old, and with her spouse, they want to get their own house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bargain merchandise such as clothing, footwear, cosmetics, perfumes, and other small items.

loans.name: Rreshit

texts.en:
Rreshit has a lime type of activity; he buys quicklime and makes it into slaked lime. He's got a pit where the quicklime quenches. 1 kg of quicklime equals 3 kg of slaked lime. 

Rreshit received a loan previously, and he used it on this activity; he is extremely grateful to his lenders.  

He now wants to do the same, and he believes that he will be given some consideration again this time,

loans.use: To purchase lime for his activity

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 38, is a mother of four who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for 13 years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, bananas, and profits from a small-time personal business. 

Naomi is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The work women in the area are currently doing on the farm was previously male tasks. They have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labour in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields, and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well of using poor traditional tools. 

The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business related expenses. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Naomi replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela is a business-minded woman who has ventured into a sari-sari store business. She has been venturing this kind of business half of her life, and her two children are finishing their studies. Thus, having this kind of business helps a lot.

However, because of the demand of her customers, she needs to have supplies for her inventories. She borrowed an amount of Php 20,000 to purchase soft drinks and canned goods for the sari-sari store business.

This will give a lot of grace to her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and canned goods for the sari-sari store business to help send the children to school

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 64 years old; she is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and four adult children. She is a workaholic woman who plants a variety of flowers.

Myrna wants to increase sales of her flower vending. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for flowers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos que tiene, Doña Francisca está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has had a small store located in her place of residence for the past 5 years. She has a lot of clients because of the good prices and variety of products that she has. Francisca is requesting a loan to buy more soaps, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to be able to have more income and a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Ana Morena

texts.es: Doña Ana vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, Ella  esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor para poder obtener mejores ingresos y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Ana lives in her own house with her son and her husband. She has been working selling fruits and vegetables for 5 years. Her business is located in the municipal market and she has many clients. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more fruits and vegetables wholesale. She wants to obtain more income and have a higher quality of living together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Rakhia

texts.en:
Rakhia is a freshman of the Economics Department, and this is her story:

“American University of Central Asia is the university which I have chosen to continue my studies.  To me, it’s a very promising and challenging university in our region. Not everyone can pass its entering exams and able to graduate from it. So being already a freshman there, I kindly ask Kiva lenders to help me with my tuition fee.

There are four children in my family. My parent’s earnings aren’t enough to pay our university tuitions, as there are two full-time students currently in my family: me and my sister. Altogether we try to make ends meet breeding the cattle, and selling them when they are big and fat.  

In spite of all our efforts, my family’s financial situation doesn’t allow me to cover the whole tuition.  With the assistance of Kiva lenders, I hope to continue my education at AUCA, become a professional economist in my country, and help my other siblings to reach their goals. 

I believe that I am the owner of my destiny.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una trabajadora mujer, con un sentido del gusto exquisito capaz de realizar excelentes productos derivados de la leche como el queso, es madre de 5 hijos y todos ellos los mantiene gracias  a su negocio pro el cual solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima que es leche, esta mujer se encarga de laborarlos y distribuirlos con el gran don de que se venden solos pues su clientes se acercan a mirar que tiene disponible para vender.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá fabricar más productos y darle un mejor bienestar a su numerosa familia pues sus hijos son de 19, 15, 14, 10 y un año de edad y todos depende en la totalidad de ella. 
Para Nelly será gran ayuda el apoyo recibido por los prestamistas pues tendrá mejores herramientas para darles un bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a hard-working woman, with an exquisite sense of taste, who is capable of making excellent dairy products such as cheese. She is the mother of 5 children and she supports all of them thanks to her business for which she is asking for a loan to purchase raw materials, which would be milk. This woman is in charge of making and distributing them, with a great gift they sell themselves, since her customers come up to look at what she has available to sell. 

With the help of the loan, she will be able to make more products and provide a better well-being to her large family since her children are ages 19, 15, 14, 10 and 1 years old and all depend completely on her.

For Nelly, the support gotten from the lenders will be a great help because she will have better tools to provide for her children's well-being.
he support gotten from the lenders

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to maker her products. She is a single mother of 5 children who depend on her.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs to cover the high season, he looks for resources to maintain his family and to be able to offer a gift from the Christ child to his son.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital they extend to a small time loaner like her. Anelia is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. 

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to pay the tuition of her student, and groceries for the store. 

In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: To pay the tuition of her student and groceries for the store

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena tiene 50 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 4 años un pequeño Chalet ubicado en el centro escolar que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más golosinas, pan dulce, galletas, dulces, churros, frutas, refrescos, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Morena is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her family. For the past 4 years she has had a small stand located in a school that is located close to her residence. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more sweets, pastries, cookies, chips, fruits, soft drinks, etc. She wants to make more income to enjoy a higher quality of living along with her family.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, pastries, cookies, chips, fruits, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is grateful for the 15,000 PHP loan granted to her. She used the loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia hopes to give her family a better future, and she desires for her business to become more established. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Roba Corazones Group

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer de 48 años de edad, soltera, madre de dos hijos de 23  y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y libros.
Ella es constante, independiente, luchadora, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de Julio’ un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, donde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor.
Amalia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español para el comercio (la tercera de la derecha, mandil celeste, manta marfil). su vida la comparte con sus dos hijos; el mayor trabaja durante el día como taxista y por las noches estudia contabilidad a nivel técnico, el hijo menor se encuentra estudiando en la escuela. Su deseos de superación la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de chompas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería y tienda de videos, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, venta de zapatos y venta de libros que realiza de lunes a domingo en su puesto de venta fijo. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 27 años que viene realizando estas actividades. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa y una librería propia para el bienestar de su familia. Y desea realizar la compra de ropa, zapatos y libros por mayor aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y generar mejores ganancias.
Es por esos motivos que Amalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, zapatos y libros por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Amalia is a 48-year-old woman, single, and mother of two children, ages 23 and 9. Her business is selling clothing, footwear and books.

She is dependable, independent, determined, patient, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the "16 de Julio" zone, an area characterized by business in all areas, where one can purchase everything from a needle to a tractor. 

Amalia is tanned, has long braided black hair, she dresses traditionally (shawl, traditional Andean pollera skirt, and hat), her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for business (she is the third from the right wearing a light blue apron and an off-white shawl). She shares her life with her two children. The older one works during the day as a taxi driver and at night studies accounting at a technical level, and the younger one is a student.  Her desires to improve herself brought her to form a communal bank of people with businesses such as sweater sales, knitting baby clothing, french fry sales, sport clothing sales, a neighborhood store, a butcher, and a video store, to ask for a loan and to prosper with their businesses.  Her business is clothing sales, footwear sales, and book sales, which she does from Monday to Sunday in a sales stall.  This is her fourth loan cycle with the institution in the 27 years she has had these businesses.  Her dream is to have her own clothing store and bookstore for her family's well-being, and she wants to purchase clothing, footwear and shoes in bulk to take advantage of the end-of-year sales and generate more income.  For these reasons, Amalia asks for a loan to purchase clothing, footwear and books in bulk to take advantage of the end-of-year sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear and books in bulk to take advantage of the end-of-year sales.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 24 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Maria, age 51, lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked making clothing for 24 years. Her tailor shop is located in her home and she has many customers due to the quality of the clothes she makes. Maria is asking for a loan to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc., and in this way be able to continue with her work that provides her with a good income.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Maria Zoni

texts.es: Flor de 57 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija de 20 años de edad, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. La cliente comprar más materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso solicita un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Flor is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her 20 year old son. She has had a stand selling food close to her place of residence for a number of years. With the money that she makes she manages to pay the household expenses. Flor will buy more raw material like rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit vegetables, etc, to have more variety in her menu. She does not have sufficient income for this investment so she is requesting a loan to buy these things. She will get more revenues and be able to establish more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more raw material like rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Raynatou

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, RAYNATOU est mariée et mère de deux enfants ; elle habite le quartier Adakpamé dans une maison dont le toit est en tôles, nourrit deux fois par jour et n’admet pas de moyens de déplacement. Elle vend du thé de diverses qualités et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. RAYNATOU sollicite un prêt en vue de pouvoir prendre soins de ses enfants et réaliser ses rêves de devenir un des plus grands fournisseurs de thé de son pays.
texts.en:
At 39 years old, Raynatou is married and a mother of two children. She lives in Adakpamé in a house with a sheet metal roof. She eats two times a day, and she doesn't have access to personal transport.

She works selling various types of tea, which she procures twice a month.

Raynatou is seeking a loan so that she can take care of her children and realize her dream of becoming one of the largest tea suppliers in the country.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of tea

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: Commerçante de poissons, FATIMA est veuve et âgé de 81 ans, habite le quartier Adakpamé non loin de la station. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au port de pêche de Lomé et les revend dans le voisinage de son quartier. Elle est logée dans une maison dont la latrine utilisée est du type traditionnelle et ne dispose pas de moyen de déplacement, mais elle a un poste radio pour s’informer en langues locales. FATIMA sollicite un appui financier pour mieux s’approvisionner afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins et prendre soin de sa santé.
texts.en:
A merchant of fish, Fatima is a widow and 81 years old. She lives in Adakpamé near the station. 

She procures her goods three times a month at the Lomé fishing port and resells them in her area. 

She lives in a house with a traditional latrine, and she has no access to personal transportation. However, she does have a radio that provides news in local languages.

Fatima is seeking financial support to procure more goods so that she can earn more and support her [family's] needs and take care of their health.

loans.use: to 14 trays of fish

loans.name: Ingrid Del Carmen

texts.es: Ingrid de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo tres hijos, ella se dedica a la extracción y venta de arena desde hace 3 años, ya tiene clientes establecidos a los cuales les comercializa la arena, con la ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Ingrid esta solicitando un crédito para poder arreglar la carreta donde lleva la arena que muestra en la fotografía y demás herramientas para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ingrid, age 35, lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  She has been mining sand and selling it for three years.  She has established customers to whom she sells the sand.  With the earnings that she gets she manages to get ahead with the household expenses.

Ingrid is requesting a loan to be able to fix that cart she uses to carry the sand, as seen in the photo, and other tools to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to fix that cart she uses to carry the sand and other tools.

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es: Margarita tiene 67 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida  y su nieta de 16 años de edad. Margarita es emprendedora, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de platos típicos tales como: yuca frita, enchiladas, papas fritas, pasteles de carne, etc. de esta forma se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida lleva el sustento a su hogar. Margarita desea construir  un corredor en su vivienda y un pasamanos de 7 metros de largo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, etc.
texts.en: Margarita is 67 years old and lives in her own home together with her life partner and her 16 year old granddaughter.  Margarita is entrepreneurial.  She works making and selling traditional dishes such as fried yucca, enchiladas, french fries, meat pies, etc.  In this way she makes a living, and together with her life partner they are able to sustain the household.  Margarita wants to build a stairwell and a handrail of 7 meters in length in her home. She is thus asking for a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI in order to invest in construction materials such as galvanized metal, wood, cement, sand, gravel and brick.

loans.use: To purchase galvanized metal, wood, cement, sand, gravel and brick in order to construct a stairwell and hand rail for her home.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Fishing is one good source for generating income for the family. Jocelyn from Sindangan, ZDN also sells fish in their neighboring barangay (community). However, she needs to buy new fish net and floaters to satisfy customers' demand with more catch of fish.

loans.use: To buy fish net and floaters to satisfy customer demand with more catch of fish

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married woman; she has six children. Tsuma owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Tsuma has operated a charcoal selling business for 12 years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces transportation charges and stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business area.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 58-year-old married father of five children. He works in a shoe-selling company to provide his family with necessary living expenses and education.   

Today, Youssef is acquiring this loan to pay his child's university tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

Youssef hopes to stay capable of providing his children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: To pay for his child's university tuition fees

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a businesswomen from Kulob town. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children. The eldest child goes to school, and the others are still small.

 Manzura's husband is businessman, too. They work together and started their business six years ago. They are mainly engaged in selling clothing. This is the only family income. Now they need to expand their business and in order to reach this goal, they need a loan. Thus Manzura applied for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing. This loan will help for development of their trade.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing to expand her small clothing-sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seafood and shells in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase vitamins and 7 calves.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 46 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Reina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 46 year old Reina has worked for some years selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence and has many customers. Reina is requesting a loan to buy corn by the hundredweight and lime so that she can keep making tortillas and so be able to have better profits and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the hundredweight and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different types of paper for the stickers he uses in the signage he places on vehicles, as well as glue, tools, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Mary, a very hardworking mother who is 36 years of age. She is a small-holder farmer from Magumoni, a remote village in the fertile Nyamira area of Kenya. This charming mother of three has been engaged in mixed farming for the past 15 years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, tea, milk,  and a variety of food crops that she plants. 

Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Nyamira. Mary has a good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of that ready market. However, the demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. 

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Mary will achieve their dreams and goals. Mary believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro de 56 años de edad, es casado de profesión Marinero.  Isidro decidió retirarse de trabajar en el mar por su edad, hoy en día es empleado del Ministerio de trabajo, lleva 8 años de dedicarse a este labor.

Tiene un hijo que es su motivo de seguir trabajando día a día, él y su esposa trabajan arduamente.

Ahora don Isidro decidió darle unos arreglos a su vivienda, quiere comprar pintura, lamina, entre otros productos que le ayuden a mejorar su hogar.

A  futuro desea pensionarse para poder descansar y disfrutar con su familia.
texts.en:
Isidro, age 56, is married.  He is a seaman by profession.  Isidro decided to stop working at sea because of his age.  He is now employed by the Work Ministry, and he has been doing this work for eight years.

He has one child, who is his motivation for continuing to work day to day.  He and his wife work arduously.

Isidro has now decided to make some repairs to his house.  He wants to buy paint and metal sheeting, among other products that will help him to improve his home.

In the future he wants to retire in order to be able to rest and to enjoy his family.

loans.use: to buy paint and metal sheeting, among other products to improve his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bu trousers, blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, underwear, lycra, etc, as the city holidays and Christmas season are coming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more women's and men's clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, etc.  para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman, age 22, with the pixelated face lives in a high risk area.  She has been selling ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] for three years.  Her business is located at her house.  She has a lot of customers because of her amiability when she sells.  The young woman lives in her own house with her mother.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rind], and soft cheese, etc.  She will buy these things in order to be able to continue making the pupusas.  This way she will be able to have better earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rind], and soft cheese, etc.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for two years. He is 30 years old, married and, together with his spouse, blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle. This will enable him to serve more customers and get more income. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and also repay the loan. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In future, he hopes to be successful and live a good life with his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Elba Isabel

texts.es: Elba tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 9 años de edad. Elba trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella y su esposo se esfuerzan mucho por llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantener el equilibrio económico.  Elba desea mejorar las condiciones de su familia para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava, etc. para encementar el piso de un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Elba is 48 years old and lives in her own home together with her life partner and her two children ages 13 and 9.  She works as a domestic or paid housekeeper and has been in this field for many years.  She and her husband work very hard to bring sustenance to their home and to maintain their economic equilibrium.  Elba wants to improve the living conditions of her family and for this reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, gravel, etc. in order to put down a floor in the room of her home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, gravel, etc. in order to put down a floor in a room of her home.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 53 years old and lives in Paglaum, Dumalinao, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with three children. 

She sells food like "puto" and "cuchinta" (rice snacks). She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan to buy ingredients for her food business to support the needs of her family. 

Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Concepcion hopes that she become one of the MIGS (member in good standing) of the cooperative.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Melita

texts.en:
Maria Melita is 56 years old and lives in Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

She has a vulcanizing shop that fixes the tires of motorcycles, bicycles etc. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to purchase vulcanizing materials to continue her services to her clients. 

She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Maria Melita hopes to have more gadgets for her business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase vulcanizing materials.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 55 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

She has a mini grocery that sells foods. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan to pay for land to make a lodging house for rent to increase her monthly income. Fedelina has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Fedelina hopes to have a jeepney for transportation.

loans.use: to pay for land.

loans.name: Donatien

texts.fr: Donatien est un jeune homme agé de 32 ans.pour subvenir à ses besoins,il s'est lancé après ses études dans la commercialisation des boissons alcooliques et des jus.il exerce comme activité secondaire,la vente des divertissements par jeux vidéos.le client souhaite reinvestir les bénéfices dans sa structure et améliorer également ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Donatien is a young man, who is 32 years old. In order to provide for his needs he began selling alcoholic drinks and juices once he had finished his studies. He also works selling video games. 

Donatien would like to reinvest his profits in his business and also improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his stock (drinks, crates of beer, juice and food products)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bacodjicoroni ACI l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, condiments (choux et oignons) et produits cosmétiques. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Sanata (femme en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (choux et oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de choux et 3 sacs d’oignons. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments à Médine.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Sanata compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of four women who are all married into monogamous households. They are, on average, 38 years old and have four children. They all live in Bacodjicoroni ACI, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. They know each other from family, neighborhood, and business ties. 

The group members work selling condiments (cabbage and onions) and cosmetics. In order to increase their stocks, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan.

Sanata (who is standing second from the right in the photo) is a large seller of condiments (cabbage and onions). She plans to use her loan to buy four sacs of cabbage and three sacs of onions. She procures her goods in Médine. Sales are made door-to-door and sometimes by order for cash or credit to a mostly female clientele. 

With this loan, Sanata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which will be used to support her children's healthcare. 

She also has a goal to increase her business through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Merys

texts.es: Merys, con tan solo 24 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a la venta mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; esta emprendedora mujer, quien recibió la propuesta de asociarse con su exsuegra para abrir un negocio de miscelánea decidió aceptarla y fue así como hicieron realidad ésta idea de negocio.  La miscelánea es muy concurrida por los habitantes del sector del barrio donde habita  en el municipio de Soledad; sus clientes  encuentran a la mano  todo tipo de artículos de papelería, detalles, productos de cuidado de la piel  y el cabello entre otros. Este negoció inicio en el año 2013, por lo que fue necesario hacer un crédito para aplicarle capital de trabajo a esta actividad de origen familiar.  Merys en su rol de madre soltera, desea brindarle una buena educación a su hijo de 3 años de edad, su hijo es su principal motivación y para conseguir los recursos pertinentes a su sustento, ella trabaja con mucho esfuerzo, 12 horas diarias de lunes a domingo. Una de las estrategia de su negocio, es la facilidad de pago  que brinda a sus clientes, así mismo el negocio se ha mantenido por la confianza que han depositado sus proveedores, al ofrecerle la mercancía a crédito aunque y al realizar  compras de contado, con las que obtiene descuentos y responderá a su clientela con un precio ajustado a su bolsillo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de papelería y juguetería, ajustando su oferta a la demanda que muy pronto, en temporada navideña y de año nuevo, se incrementará y esto generará un mayor volumen de ventas, pues sus inventarios están a la medida de las solicitudes de compras.
texts.en:
Although Merys is only 24 years old, she spent many years selling products through specialized catalogs, through which she promoted the items that she sold. She is an enterprising woman who received a proposition from her ex-mother-in-law that they open a store selling miscellany (stationary, toys, etc) and decided to accept, and this is how her business came into being. 
The store is very busy with the inhabitants of their neighborhood in the town of Soledad. Her customers can find at their fingertips all types of stationary, decorations, skin- and hair-care products, and other things. They began the business in 2013 and they needed a loan to have working capital for this family business. Merys, in her role as a single mother, wants to give her 3 year old boy a good education. Her son is her main motivation and she works very hard to get the resources she needs to care for him: 12 hours a day from Monday to Sunday. 
One of her business strategies is the ease of paying that she offers to her customers. Likewise, the business is trusted by its suppliers that provide merchandise on credit and she pays cash which means that she gets discounts and can pass these on to her customers as prices that match their means. 
She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy stationary and toys. She needs these to meet demands that will very soon increase for the Christmas season which generates a greater volume of sales and her inventory needs to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: stationary items and toys.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Madame Amah a pour conjoint un menuisier. Elle a 03 enfants de 7, 10 et 15ans qui sont scolarisés. Elle revend depuis 1994 des sacs et de l'huile rouge au marché dans la ville de KPALIME. Elle s'approvisionne généralement à Lomé. Manquant de fonds pour acheter plus de marchandises, elle demande un troisième prêt pour acheter des sacs afin de servir ses clients. Elle espère agrandir l'activité et bien scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Amah's husband is a carpenter. She has three children, aged 7, 10, and 15 who are enrolled in school. Since 1994, she has been selling bags and red oil (palm oil) in a market in the town of Kpalimé. She generally stocks up on merchandise in Lomé. 

Lacking the funds to purchase more merchandise, she is asking for a third loan to buy bags so as to serve her customers. She hopes to grow her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase bags and red oil (palm oil)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja en un taller automotriz ubicado cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, El joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated in the photo is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area. He works in an automotive workshop located close to his home. With what he earns from his work, he is able to cover some of the household expenses. The young man lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter. He is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp as, in the community where he lives, nobody has electrical light and what he earns isn't enough to have it installed. The lamp is a charging station with solar panels in the form of a lamp that is suitable for houses in rural areas that do not have electricity supplies. All the family would benefit from this purchase as they would have their own light in the evenings.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: El Pari Group

texts.es:
Kristian es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de seis y dos años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es independiente, trabajadora, constante, buena madre, emprendedora, y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad, un área popular caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas, de clima tropical con una temperatura entre 27 – 32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Kristian es de tez trigueña, cabello largo rojizo, su lengua materna es el español y habla quechua por herencia familiar (sentada al centro). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus dos hijos; el mayor está iniciando la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con actividades como; venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de productos cosméticos, venta de ropa y venta de fruta, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comidas típicas del lugar, como; Locro de gallina (sopa; pollo dorado, arroz, papas picadas), Majadito (carne deshidratada, arroz, plátano frito y huevo), zonzos en pacumuto (yuca molida con queso a la parrilla), todo acompañado de refrescos tradicionales como; Chicha (preparada en base a maíz) y Somó (similar a la Chicha pero incluye el hervido del maíz). Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con esta actividad. Su sueño es tener un restaurante, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
Es por esos motivos que Kristian solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Kristian is a 26 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has two children, aged six and two. Her business is selling food. 

She is independent, hardworking, stable, a good mother, entrepreneurial, and very responsible. She does her work in the south part of the city, a popular area characterized by the growing commerce in all areas. It has a tropical climate and a temperature of between 27 – 32 degrees celsius the whole year round.   

Kristian has olive colored skin and long reddish hair. Her mother tongue is Spanish and she speaks Quechua through family heritage. She is sitting in the middle. She makes her life with her spouse, who works in construction, and their two children. The oldest is starting school and the youngest stays with her. The need to expand her business led her to form a group of people with activities such as selling sandwiches, plaster artisan crafts, selling beverages,  selling books, selling cosmetic products, selling clothes and selling fruit. They did this to ask for a loan and continue with their businesses. Her business is selling traditional food from the area such as Locro de gallina (chicken, rice and potato soup), Majadito (dried meat, fried plantains and egg), zonzos en pacumuto (grilled yucca ground up with cheese). Al of it comes with traditional beverages such as Chicha (a corn based drink) and Somó (similar to Chicha, but it includes the boiled corn). This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has been doing this activity. Her dream is to have a restaurant and she wants to expand her business by buying tables and chairs to serve a greater number of customers. That is Kristian is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs to serve a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to serve a greater number of customers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Miguel trabaja como jornalero y albañil desde hace mucho tiempo. Miguel desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de un cuarto y para repellar las paredes de la vivienda dado que actualmente son de adobe las cueles son propensas a que los insectos aniden en ella.
texts.en: Miguel is 27 years old. He lives in his own house with his life's companion and their 6 year old son. Miguel has worked as a day laborer and bricklayer for many years. Miguel wants to improve his living conditions and that is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying cement, sand and gravel to put in a cement floor in a room and to finish the walls of the house. Right now they are adobe and prone to having insects make their nests there.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to put in a cement floor in a room and to finish the walls on the house.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos tiene 42 años de edad  y se gana la vida por medio de su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y lociones. Ademas, trabaja como albañil los fines de semana. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Carlos está construyendo su vivienda pero todavía le hace falta recursos económicos para terminar la casa. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y pintura para repellar y pintar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Carlos is 42 years old. He earns his living through his business selling new clothes and lotions. In addition, he works as a bricklayer on the weekends. In this way, he earns his living and supports the household budget. Carlos is building his house but he still needs some financial resources to finish it. Because of this, he has asked FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying cement, sand and paint to finish and paint the walls of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and paint to finish and paint the walls on his house.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en: Danny is 36 years old, and married with 3 children. He has a sari-sari store in Sto. Rosario, Sindangan, ZDN. His sari-sari business helps him generate income. But because he needs to have an extra activity to invest, he wants to venture into a billiard business for recreation. He is going to have the billiard table available for rent. This would be of great help where he can also generate extra income to sustain family needs.

loans.use: To buy a billiard table to generate extra income to sustain family needs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: From Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, ZDN, the woman in the picture behind her booming sari-sari store business is no other than Lydia. She is married with children. She has been in her business for 20 years. This business greatly helps her to send her children to school. But because of the demand of her customers in their town, she needs to have additional inventories on soap, shampoo, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc. Her dream of expanding her business will come true.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell in her store so she can send her children to school

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town and has been in this business for 4 years. He is 28 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his child as well as repay the loan. 

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Clara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Clara de 28 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato y se dedica al comercio. El esposo trabaja prestando sus servicios como seguridad pública,  en esta relación han procreado un hijo. Clara vive solo con el esposo, el hijo y el suegro.

Clara tiene dos años de administrar un cafetín en el centro escolar de la comunidad, este trabajo lo aprendió de una prima que tenía un cafetín en la escuela; entonces ella le dijo que le ayudara con el negocio fue así que ella aprendido el trabajo y desde ya hace dos años se independizo. Al mismo tiempo se dedicaba ya que hace dos años en un proyecto de capacitar jóvenes; pero se terminó el proyecto y hoy solo trabaja en el cafetín que está a una distancia de 15 minutos de la casa de donde ella vive, viaja a pie y en horario de las 7 am a las 4 pm  

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una vaca parida que le venden y que no quiere dejar esta oportunidad ya que es de muy buena raza y se la venden barata,  y la otra para la invertirá en la compra de mercadería para el cafetín churros galletas y dulces y también comprara preparaciones para las pupusas que hace para los estudiantes  y también comprara seis cajas de sodas que le han buscado para la graduación ya que la época escolar está por finalizar 

Clara los sueños de ella es que este próximo año que viene que sea de lo mejor en la ventas del cafetín y que poco a poco con las ganancias invertir más y con la ganancias que le de la vaca ir ayudandole al esposo con los gastos de la casa para que el hijo cuando estudie se prepare mucho y sea un profesional
texts.en: Clara is 28 years old. She studied up to high school and works in commerce. Her husband works as a security guard, and they have a son together. Clara lives only with her husband, her son and her father in law. For two years, Clara has worked managing a small cafe at the school of her community. She learned this job from her cousin, who had a cafe in the school and asked her to help her with the business. This is how she learned the job and continued doing it independently two years ago. At the same time, she was working in a project training young people. However, the project finished and nowadays she only works in the cafe, which is 15 minutes from her house. She walks there and her schedule is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m.  She is requesting the loan to buy a calved cow they are offering her, a good opportunity because it is from good breed and she is getting it at a good price. The rest of the loan she will use to buy merchandise for her cafe: churros, cookies and sweets, and also the ingredients for the pupusas (stuffed tortillas) she makes for the students. She will also buy six boxes of sodas that she needs for graduation, because the school year is about to finish. Clara dreams of having more sales in her cafe next year, and that little by little she can invest more her earnings; and that with those plus the earnings from the cow, she will keep helping her husband with household expenses so that their son can study well and become professional.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow, churros, cookies and sweets, and also the ingredients for the pupusas (stuffed tortillas) she makes for the students, as well as 6 boxes of sodas.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: In Pob., Leon B. Postigo, ZDN lives a woman who enjoys fish vending to help support her family. She is Esterlita, 51, and happily married. She has been vending fish for 20 years and has become a good member of the cooperative. Because she needs to buy a new battery and fishing nets, she requested a loan from PMPC. She is so glad for the help extended.

loans.use: To buy a battery and fishing net to support her fish business to sustain family living

loans.name: Lilianita

texts.en: From Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, ZDN, a woman who embraces business is no other than Lilianita. She has a sari-sari store business and also vends fish. These businesses help her generate income and support her family. But because of the need to repair her fishing business, she requested a loan from PMPC to buy materials for fishing and boat repair.

loans.use: To buy materials of fishing boat repair to support her family

loans.name: Vitellana

texts.en:
Vitellana busies herself in her gardening activities in her own backyard. She is 59 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad, Philippines. She is married and has eight adult children. 

For additional income, Vitellana engages in a cosmetics business, and delivery of different crops depends on the orders from her client.  She earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to buy stock for her business. Vitellana has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, Vitellana hopes to have her own boutique for cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Cheery

texts.en:
Cheery is a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She gets her financing needs from the Cooperative, especially for her wholesale feed business.  Recently, she bought piglets to increase her income. 

She has approached Paglaum for a loan to pay for bulk feed. She deeply wishes this will help give her income a big boost. Cheery looks for better business opportunities, and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase bulk feed to sell and yield more income

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
After Mahmoud finished all the repayment of the installments of his first loan given by Kiva lenders, he applied for a second Youth loan of 120,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase a large TV screen for his family's house  because their TV is broken down and it doesn't work well. 

With the first loan, Mahmoud purchased a laptop to use in his career. The first loan helped  Mahmoud very much to increase his skills through learning a lot of computer programs and applications. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan and hopes to be financed in this loan, too.

loans.use: to purchase a large TV screen for his family's house

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is married and has two children. They are living in Baku region but Vugar is an IDP--Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli city. His wife is a housewife.

 Now Vugar has rented  a van and transports food products. He closed his first loan on time and this his second loan. Today he wants to support his new business and for this reason he has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more products to transport and sell. Vugar is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy more food products to transport and sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 35 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with 4 children of school age. 

Rosemarie has been engaged in a hog fattening business for 8 years now. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity, and that amount is so helpful to support their family income. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional 3 piglets and 1 sack of feed for her hog fattening business activity. Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. 

In the future, Rosemarie hopes to expand her hog fattening business by acquiring more piglets to supply to her town.

loans.use: To purchase three additional piglets and one sack of feed

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 73 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children who are now adults. 

Leonida has earned a living from her snack vending business for more than 14 years now. She is also receiving support from her children. Leonida earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing a variety of additional snacks for retail. Leonida has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. 

In the future, Leonida hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of additional snacks for retail

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth de 23 años de edad, se dedica al comercio en general,  ella vende calzado, pantalones y adicionalmente obtiene otros ingresos, ofreciendo servicios de peluquería y tratamientos capilares. En esta temporada se acercan las fiestas de navidad y la celebración de la llegada del año nuevo y con ello las ventas se incrementan, tanto en la mercancía como en el servicio de mejoramiento de imagen personal, pues las familias obtienen más dinero, por el impacto de la economía de esta época y también gastan mucho más. Esto es aprovechado por Lisbeth, para surtir más su negocio y estar dispuesta a trabajar en la peluquería extendiendo su horario. Lisbeth recuerda que mientras estudiaba en una academia de belleza, hace 3 años, aprendía en el negocio de su madre, quien se dedicaba al comercio de artículos, hasta el momento en que se enfermó y  debió asumir el negocio, al que le adicionó servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen, para ejercitarse en lo que había aprendido, cuando fue a la academia. Con este negocio le ha ido bien y sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito,  directamente al consumidor final,  que son principalmente, profesores del sector y vecinos, además de referidos por estos. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén de ropa, para ganar más y ayudar a su familia,  especialmente quiere  que su padre no se esfuerce tanto trabajando, pudiéndolo apoyar cada vez más. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito semanalment,e trabajando desde las 5 de la tarde, hasta las 10 de la noche. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un tocador y mercancía como ropa, perfumeria, calzado y productos de belleza, para la temporada, así su negocio mejorará vendiendo más al ofrecer un mayor surtido.
texts.en:
Lisbeth, 23 years old, works in general sales.  She sells footwear, pants, and also earns income by offering hair care services and capillary treatments.    At this time of year when the Christmas and New Year festivals approach, her sales increase, as much of merchandise as of services to improve personal image.   Families have more money because of the effect of the finances of this time period, and they also spend much more.

Lisbeth takes advantage of this to stock more for business and be ready to work in the hair salon, extending her hours.  Lisbeth remembers that when she was studying in a beauty school three years ago, she was learning to work in her mother's business. Her mother worked at selling various items, until the point in time when she became ill and Lisbeth had to take over the business, adding services to enhance personal appearance, in order to use the knowledge she gained while attending school.   

Things have gone well for her with this business and she carries out sales for cash and on credit directly to the final consumer.  Her customers are mostly teachers from the area, and neighbors, as well as customers referred by them.   Lisbeth's goal looking ahead is to have a storehouse of clothing, in order to earn more and help her family.  She especially wants her father not to work as hard as he does,  by being able to help him more and more.  She makes sales for cash and on weekly credit plans, and is working from 5PM until 10PM.  

Now Lisbeth is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has made through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a display case and merchandise such as clothing, perfume, footwear and beauty products, for the season.  Her business will then improve, selling more through offering a better selection.

loans.use: to buy a display case and merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, footwear and beauty products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old and does farming in Nakuru town where he grows maize and beans to sell. He is married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with one child. He has been in this business for five years and right now his monthly income is KES. 6,000. 

He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in his farm. He will use the anticipated profits for expanding his farming. 

This is Peter's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hope is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
To have additional income, Erlinda has been engaging in a hog-raising business for more than five years. She is 52 years old and has five adult-age children. She aims to further improve her business to satisfy the family's necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Having inadequate capital, she would like to access an additional loan of PHP33,000 to buy  hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She is hoping that she will access her loan request to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy  hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Bati

texts.en:
Bati is a married woman with one child. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. Bati dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Vicente Gonzalez

texts.es:
Vicente de 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad y casado. Vicente solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato, tuvo que dejar de estudiar porque en su época  era muy difícil el acceso al transporte, por lo que tomo la decisión y se dedicó a trabajar como agricultor. Su es ama de casa y con él vive su esposa, su hijo y la esposa de su hijo.

Vicente es agricultor desde los 19 años de edad, aprendió de su padre que también era agricultor, también es comerciante, administra una tienda en su casa desde hace 3 años. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar productos para la tienda y abastecerla, productos como granos básicos, de higiene personal, para la cocina, algunas verduras y vegetales.

Vicente espera mejorar su negocio y fortalecerlo para depender totalmente de él ya que por su edad ya no trabaja la tierra como lo hacía antes.
texts.en:
Vicente is 53 years old. He is married and he has one married, adult son. Vicente was only able to study until secondary school. He had to leave his studies because when he was younger it was very difficult to access transportation. He made the decision to start working as a farmer. He lives with his wife who is a housewife, his son and his son's wife. 

Vicente has been a farmer since he was 19 years old. He learned from his father who also was a farmer. He is also a merchant. He has run a store in his house for three years. The loan will be used to purchase products for the store like basic grains, personal hygiene and kitchen products and some vegetables. 

Vicente hopes to improve  and strengthen his business. Due to his age, he can not work the land like he did before.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, personal hygiene and kitchen products and some vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his recently-opened carpentry shop

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine est une femme de 37 ans fiancée et mère de 2 enfants de 12 et 14 ans. Elle commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 15 ans déjà. Elle ouvert un call box dans lequel elle commercialise le crédit de communication et quelques friandises. Son activité fonctionne bien elle est souvent bloquée quand son crédit fini à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Ceci l'oblige à finir son crédit pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner à nouveau. c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit. Il lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et ses bénéfices. Bénéfice qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aussi d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Martine is a woman of 37, engaged to be married, and the mother of two children of 12 and 14 years old. She has been working as a merchant in a neighborhood of the capital for 15 years now. She opened a call box where she sells phone use credits and some snacks. 

Her business is doing well, but she is often in difficulty because her credit runs out due to the small size of her working capital. This obliges her to terminate her credit so as to be able to stock up again. This is why she is requesting this loan. It will allow her not only to better satisfy her clientele, but also to grow her turnover and her profit.The profit will permit her to cover necessary family expenses and also grow the business.

loans.use: to add to the amount of her communication credit

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Stella, 39 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kemera, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and is blessed with one adorable child. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her child, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Nyamira area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going child.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, noodles, matches, eggs, canned goods, cooking oil and toiletries.

loans.name: Sylivest

texts.en: Sylivest is a hardworking, Ugandan man, aged 56 years with nine children. He lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a retail shop and farming since 1977 for increased income. He hopes to educate his children despite the challenge of lack of enough capital to expand his business for increased profits. Sylivest is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 59 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo, no logró estudiar, sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad porque tenía que trabajar.

Luis es agricultor, tiene 20 años de experiencia trabajando con el cultivo de maíz, aprendió de su padre que también se dedicaba a lo mismo, todos los días viaja 2 km para llegar al lugar donde cultiva.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizante, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar 10,000 mts cuadrados de maíz. Luis espera obtener una buena cosecha para que el próximo año que su esposa se gradué de enfermera hacerle un pequeña celebración.
texts.en:
Luis is 59 years old. He has a common-law wife and one child. He was not able to study; his parents did not give him that opportunity, because he had to work. 

Luis is a farmer. He has 20 years of experience working with corn crops. He learned from his father, who dedicated himself to the same work. He travels 2 kilometers each day to reach the place where he raises his crops. 

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to plant 10,000 square meters of corn. Luis hopes to obtain a good harvest, so that next year, when his wife graduates as a nurse, he can throw her a little celebration.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Julio Adalberto

texts.es: Julio tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 13 años y 3 años de edad. Julio se dedica a hacer viajes en su localidad lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y mantener la economía del hogar.  Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión del servicio de agua potable en su vivienda y para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arana, ladrillo y pagará para la conexión del agua potable.
texts.en:
Julio is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their two daughters aged 13 and 3 years old. Julio works in the transportation business in his area allowing him to earn a livelihood and maintain the household economy.

With the desire to improve their lives and those of their families, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in a potable water connection in his home and invest in the construction of a retaining wall.

With the amount requested, he will buy cement, sand, brick and pay for the water connection.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and brick to build a retaining wall and pay for a potable water connection.

loans.name: Ladiri Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Ladiri est constitué de six  femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bacodjicoroni ACI l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce  tel que la vente de,  condiments et tubercules.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
