Madame Kadiatou (femme assise devant sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des légumes et condiments. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 3 sacs  d’aubergines et  4 sacs de concombres. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Médine. La revente s’effectue à Bacodjicoroni ACI au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kadiatou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
This group Ladiri is composed of six women, all married and living in monogamous households. The women average 44 years of age and six children each, all living in Bacodjicoroni ACI, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through their tontines in the district and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in commerce, such as selling condiments and tubers. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Kadiatou (the woman sitting in front in the photo) is famous for selling vegetables and condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of eggplant and 4 sacks of cucumbers. She gets her supplies from Médine. Her sales are made to a customer base composed mostly of women paying with cash in Bacodjicoroni ACI. 

With this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs that will be used to meet her children’s sundry needs. And the rest will be invested in her business. She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goals, which include expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a farmer based in Koyo village, in Nandihills Kenya. She owns a 1.25 acre piece of land and grows tea.  Gladys also raises two dairy animals. 
She has planted nine trees on her land for the aesthetic appearance and environmental health. 

Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have eight children with a husband and has stayed married for 37 years! 

Gladys is seeking a loan to purchase cereals to replenish her stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in the Nandihills market, only a few kilometers from Gladys home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. 

By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, Gladys gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Gladys livelihood. 

She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she had.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 29 years old, single with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher for two years. Moses was inspired by science teachers to join the profession since they were few teachers in service. 

Moses has a dream of becoming a rich man and he is a hard worker, but he challenge of low income. Moses wants money to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Teresa Magdalena

texts.es:
Teresa de 31 años de edad, esta soltera y no tiene hijos, Tuvo la oportunidad de terminar una carrera universitaria, se graduó en 2009  fue hasta 2012 que encontró trabajo. Con ella vive su hermano que por el momento se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Teresa es empleada, trabaja para una institución gubernamental en la que da orientación y educación a  niños y niñas, tiene año y medio trabajando.

El préstamo será utilizado para solventar algunos gastos personales, y para cancelar unos talleres escolares en los que está participando. Sueña con remodelar su casa para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Teresa is 31 years old. She is single and she does not have any children. She had the opportunity to finish her university degree. She graduated in 2009. She found work in 2012. Her brother lives with her. He takes care of household duties. 

Teresa is employed. She works for a government institution. She gives guidance and education to children. She has been working for a year and a half.
 
The loan will be used to take care of some personal expenses and to pay for some educational workshops that Teresa is participating in. She dreams about renovating her house in order to live better.

loans.use: take care of personal expenses and pay for educational workshops.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre  femmes, les membres du groupe Sewa sont toutes  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bacodjicoroni ACI l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de légumes   (tomates, chou et aubergine). Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso   et  sont  à leur  2ème position  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite) a une bonne notoriété, car les condiments  très prises par les femmes à Bacodjicoroni ACI. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de tomates, 2 sacs de choux et 3 sacs d’aubergines. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiment à Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant à Bacodjicoroni ACI à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 70 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
This group Sewa is composed of four women, all married and living in polygamous households. The women average 39 years of age and four children each, all living in Bacodjicoroni ACI, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through their tontines in the district and their revenue-generating businesses. The businesses of the group members are differently, including in particular selling vegetables (tomatoes, cabbage, eggplant). 

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the group members decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Kadiatou (the woman standing at the far right) has a good reputation, since [her condiments are highly prized] by the women in Bacodjicoroni ACI. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 baskets of tomatoes, 2 sacks of cabbage, and 3 sacks of eggplant. She gets her supplies from Médine. Her runs her business with cash, selling to women customers in Bacodjicoroni ACI. 

With this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 70,000 francs that will be used to support herself and to invest in her business. Her goal is to earn loyalty in this Soro Yiriwaso partnership in order to benefit a lot from loans.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Sally, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandihills area of Kenya. Sally, 55, has been farming for the past 10 years. 

Through those years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Sally is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. 

That is why, every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. She is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Sally could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Sally, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Sally believes that this loan will be of great help to her. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business.

Increased profits will allow Sally to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a 30 years old female married with one child living in Kasese Uganda.  She sells bananas to supplement her family's income, that was not enough to meet future demands. 

Evaline has managed to acquire land with her business proceeds and has a dream of expanding her business. However she is faces a challenge of limited capital. Evaline wants money to buy bananas for reselling.

loans.use: to buy bananas) for reselling.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a hard working married man with four children. Three attend school. He mainly buys and sells of rice, beans and maize. 

He supplements his income with farming. He desires to expand and grow his business but is limited due to price fluctuations. 

He will use the loan facility to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Sadik

texts.en:
Sadik is 27 years old married with two children, and one attends school in Hoima Uganda. 

He buys and sells beans, maize among other items. His dream is to develop and expand his business, however he faces inadequate capital. He will use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with six children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition.

With the loan, Christine is requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Zibératou

texts.fr: Âgée de 42ans, Madame Zibératou revend des ignames au marché de KPALIME. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes de l'intérieur et son premier crédit lui permettra d'acheter des ignames. Elle souhaite étendre son activité et voir ses enfants s'épanouir. Mariée, ils ont 05 enfants en charge dont 04 scolarisés.
texts.en: Mrs. Zibératou is 42 years old. She sells yams at the market in Kpalime. She buys her stock at towns further inland and her first loan will enable her to buy yams. She would like to expand her business and see her children do well. She is married with five dependent children of whom four go to school.

loans.use: To buy yams.

loans.name: Pireli

texts.en:
Pireli runs a small businessman. He is married and has three children and they live in the Baku region with his big family. 

Pireli's wife helps him with his work. He grow vegetables (tomato, cucumber, potato, onion and etc.) and has been in this business for 10 years. Today he plans to repair his water system for his greenhouse. 

For this reason Pireli needs a 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for a loan. He is confident that the loan will help increase his business and enable his to earn more money.

loans.use: to repair water system.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en: Shabnam, who is 20 years old, got married early. Unfortunately, her family life was a failure, and soon she divorced her husband with a little baby (now 5 months old) in her arms. Shabnam lives in the town of Kulob with her baby, mother and brother. Her mother is a saleswoman who sells clothing at a local market. Shabnam also works as she does not want to be a burden to her mother. Shabnam has a retail outlet where she is now engaged in the sale of women's shoes. She needs some funds for developing her small trading business. Shabnam is taking out a loan to purchase a new assortment of women's shoes.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of women's shoes to sell

loans.name: Mirium

texts.en:
Mirium is 36 years old married with four children, living in Kasese Uganda.  She sells cassava flour, a business she has operated for four years.  It has enabled her pay school fees for her children.  

Mirium has a dream of expanding her business, but she is faces stiff competition.  Mirium is requesting for a loan to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Nahera

texts.en:
Nahera is a married mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nahera has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. Her main business challenges are delayed payments by creditors and transportation. Nahera dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. She wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Amani Suka Group

texts.en:
Samira, who is in her mid 20's, is married and has two children, one in school and one still young. Samira has been running a pharmacy for two years. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Samira's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to to buy a table which she puts outside her pharmacy to hold the fruits that she sells.  She also increased her stock of medicine and has repaid her loan successfully.  Samira is happy with the loan. She used the profit to reinvest in her business. Samira will use this loan to buy medicines that sell quickly. She dreams of opening another pharmacy.

Samira will share this loan with her group "Amani Suka", consisting of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicines that sell quickly.

loans.name: Gentiana

texts.en: Gentiana used her previous loan to repair a damaged stable. Since then, she has become a mother again and appears in the photo with her little bundle. There are no doors and windows in the house Gentiana has built and her children have been living in such conditions these past months now that winter has arrived in their northern region. "It's been very cold and if we continue to live like this, unfortunately, my kids will get sick, God forbid," said Gentiana looking way worried.

loans.use: to install doors, windows and flooring in her house

loans.name: Dominique Bertrand

texts.fr: Dominique est un homme de 29 ans fiancée et père de 2 enfants de 2 et 4 ans. Il commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 6 ans déjà. Elle ouvert un call box dans lequel elle commercialise le crédit de communication et quelques friandises. Son activité fonctionne bien il est souvent bloquée quand son crédit fini à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Ceci l'oblige à finir son crédit pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner à nouveau. c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce crédit. Il lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et ses bénéfices. Bénéfice qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aussi d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Dominique is a 29-year-old man who is engaged to be married. He is the father of two children, aged 2 and 4 years old. He has been a merchant in a district in the capital for six years already. He opened a call box, where he sells communication credits and some snacks. His business is doing well. 

He is often stuck when his credits run out due to his meager capital. So he has to sell all of his credits in order to be able to stock up again. For this reason, he is requesting this loan. It will enable him not only to increase [his stock of credits] to meet customer demand better but also to increase his sales and profits, which will allow him to meet the needs of his family and also to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his communication credits

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha, 51, is from Iraq.  She is married and has five children. She supports her family income by owning and operating a grocery store.  She has been in business since 1994. 

Sabiha sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. She has good experience in her field and has became well-known in the surrounding area.  

Sabiha is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy a small generator and install a rolling shutter. She is aiming to grow her business more and expand her shop in the future so she can increase her profits and make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and install a rolling shutter.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de elaboración y venta de panes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea continuar trabajando para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como azúcar, mantequilla, harina, huevos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her business making and selling bread.  She has worked in this business for years, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.  She would like to continue doing her work and in this way keep on supporting her family.  

She is requesting the loan in order to buy goods such as sugar, butter, flour, and eggs, as well as other products.  She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as sugar, butter, flour, and eggs, among other products for her bread-making business.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi vit avec son conjoint et leurs 04 enfants à Lomé. En 2007, elle a démarré la vente des produits d'alimentation générale à domicile et achète au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle se fait aidée par 01 personne et demande un sixième crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, Essi veut assurer l'éducation des enfants et améliorer son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Essi lives with her husband and their four children in Lomé. In 2007, she started off selling grocery items at her home. She purchases her merchandise at the Grand Market of Lomé. She is helped by one person and is asking for a sixth loan to purchase some merchandise. For the future, Essi wants to ensure her children’s education and to improve her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Kankeletigui Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre  femmes, les membres du groupe Kankélétigui sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bacodjicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, produits cosmétiques, tubercules et condiments. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Aïssata (femme arrêtée  à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente  d’articles divers et de produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de savons, 4 paquets de l’allumette et 25 brosses. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako et effectue ses  ventes au comptant et à crédit en ambulant et parfois sur commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Aïssata compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui group is made up of four women who are all married and living in monogamous households. On average they are 41 years old with four children. They all live in Bacodjicoroni, one of the districts of Bamako. They met through family and neighbourhood contacts and through their income generating activities. The members of this group sell cosmetic products, tubers, and condiments. In order to build up their reserves of stock, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their second solidarity loan.
Mrs. Aissata (the woman on the extreme right in the photo) has a good reputation in the sale of various articles and cosmetic products. She plans to use her loan to buy two boxes of soap, four packets of matches, and 25 brushes. She gets her supplies in Bamako and sells her wares as an itinerant saleswoman for cash and for credit and sometimes to order, to a mainly female clientele. Mrs. Aissata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90 000 FCFA with this loan, which she will use to pay for school fees and medical expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy various articles.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with one child. She buys, packages and sells hardwood charcoal. At first, Luvuno used to buy the charcoal already packaged but she was able to expand her storage area and she can now store up to 60,000 kg of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal and sells to small businesses in the zone. 

Luvuno needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet demand. Her greatest desire is to provide education for her one child who attends school so that she can guarantee the child a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal so she can provide education to her child to guarantee the child a prosperous future.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina, 51 years old, is a widow. She has only one son who works in the Russian Federation and comes home from time to time. But her daughter-in-law lives with Nigina in the district of Bohtar, located in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. Bohtar is a sunny district and its inhabitants are pleasant and very polite people, Nigina being one of them. She is a very kind, hardworking and hospitable person.

Nigina is taking out a loan to renovate her house. She is very hopeful that it will help to repair her house because she is afraid that the coming winter will be very cold and she fears for her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 33-year-old  woman from Tbilisi. She lives with her brother and sister-in-law. Both family members are employed and earn fixed salaries. Tea has a great desire to have her own activity and generate some income for her welfare. She has requested a loan from MFO Credo, which has a joint initiative with Kiva giving people a chance to start or re-start businesses. The loan of 900 USD will greatly help this motivated woman, as she will be able to purchase a sewing machine in order to sew clothes to sell, thereby generating her own income. 

Tea hopes that, in the future, she will be capable of expanding her business to a wider sewing workshop to cover almost all of her customers' needs. This loan will be a great support for the family. Tea is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to sew clothes and generate income

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran, 38 years old, is a responsible mother of two children. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of four people. Naziran is well-trained in cloth stitching and provides stitching services from her home. 

Naziran needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of funds, Naziran is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, which has issued her loan, as requested. Naziran is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her stitching work

loans.name: Jeannette Maricela

texts.es:
Jeannette de 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos y ambos estudian. Solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato debido a que sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para darle seguimiento a sus estudios. Su esposo es docente pero también es agricultor, solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Jeannette es ama de casa, pero también apoya a su esposo en las labores agrícolas desde hace 3 años, todos los días se levanta de madrugada y después de hacer los oficios de la casa, se dedica al cultivo, contrata personas para que le ayuden.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para hacer la última aplicación al cultivo, luego quedara pendiente la cosecha que Jeannette espera sea abundante para que al venderla pueda mantener estudiando a sus hijos con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Jeannette, 38,  is married and has two children who are both students. She was only able to study up to the end of high school because her parents didn't have the finances to enable her to continue with her studies. Her husband, as well as being a teacher, is also a farmer. Only he and their children live with her.

Jeannette is a housewife but has also been helping her husband as a farm labourer for 3 years. Every day she gets up in the early hours of the morning and, after taking care of the housework, she tends the crops. She is hiring people to help her.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and to pay for labour to give the final treatment to the crops. Then all that will remain is the harvest, which Jeannette hopes will be abundant so that, upon selling it, she will be able to use the earnings to support her children through their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Davlatmo

texts.en:
Davlatmo is an active and capable woman at the age of 56 years old. She is married and her husband works in the energy industry. Davlatmo lives in Kulob with her husband, two sons, two daughters-in-law and a grandson. 

One of her daughters-in-law is a seamstress. Three years ago, she taught Davlatmo to sew and to cut dresses.  Davlatmo then opened her own sewing business. Thus, she has taken orders for sewing women's national dresses for three years now. 

She likes her work because it brings her stable income. Now Davlatmo needs to update her old sewing machine and buy the necessary fabrics for sewing. With these intentions she asks for a loan. Your support is important for her.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and necessary fabrics to sew.

loans.name: Erenia Aleida

texts.es:
Erenia de 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 3° grado porque sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para seguir dándole el estudio. Su esposo es agricultor y sus hijos trabajan con él.

Erenia trabaja co0mo ama de casa en una casa que ella cuida desde hace 5 años. Todos los días se levanta  las 6:00 am prepara desayuno y almuerzo y luego se va a trabajar a dicha casa y sale de trabajar a las 4:00 pm. Luego de llegar a su casa, prepara la venta de pupusas que tiene desde hace 3 años.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar arena, cemento, ladrillos, grava, piedra y demás para construir un muro alrededor de su casa. Erenia espera todo salga bien para vivir más segura con su familia.
texts.en:
Erenia is 49 years old, is married and has 2 children.  She was only able to study until the 3rd grade because her parents were not financially able to continue sending her to school.  Her husband is a farmer and her children work with him.   

Erenia works as a housekeeper, in a home that she has worked in for 5 years.  Every day she wakes up at 6:00 AM and makes breakfast and lunch.  She then goes to her housekeeping job and leaves work at 4:00 PM.  After arriving back home, she sets up her stand to sell pupusas, which she has been doing for 3 years now.

The loan will be used to buy sand, cement, bricks, gravel, stone, and other materials to build a wall around her house.  She is hoping that all will go well so that she can live more safely with her family.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, gravel, and stone to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to resell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to contribute to his wife's pregnancy and parental leave insurance, as she is not presently entitled to them

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice, 39 years old, is married. She and her spouse have been blessed with 3 children. For the past 4 years, Beatrice has been a dairy and poultry farmer in Nakuru. She will be using this loan to buy more stock of poultry feed. She will use the anticipated profits to grow her farming business and to repay the loan. This is Beatrice's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell in the animal markets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase decorations for his store to attract a lot of customers.

loans.name: Kakwasi

texts.en:
Kakwasi is a  married woman with four school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water.

For the past two years, Kakwasi has operated her business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is transportation. Kakwasi dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

Kakwasi wants to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase more stock of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Ernesto De Jesus

texts.es:
Ernesto de 57 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres no podían pagar los costos. Su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella vive con él.

Tiene cerca de 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, esa actividad la aprendió y heredo de su padre. Hace 5 años un amigo le enseño a trabajar en el comercio de ganado, compra ganado en repasto y luego lo vende recuperado a mejor precio. Ahora trabaja como agricultor y ganadero

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una pareja de bueyes que los necesita para su actividad agrícola, además podría alquilarlos o cobrar por el servicio de aradura.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 57 years old, married with no children. He went to school through the 3rd grade, but couldn’t continue because his parents couldn’t afford the expense. His partner is a housewife, and they live together, just the two of them. 

He has been working in agriculture for about 15 years. It’s work he learned and inherited from his father. About 5 years ago a friend taught him to raise livestock. He buys animals for fattening and later sells them for a better price. He now works his farm land and raises livestock. 

He will use this loan to buy a pair of oxen that he needs for his farming. He will also be able to rent them out or charge people for his ploughing services.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for supplies for resale to his local community.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! The above picture presents Susan, a small scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Salama, in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with five children. 

For the last 15 years, Susan has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back; she really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Susan finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm because of a lack of farm inputs. 

Susan is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. She will purchase quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate to increased income levels. Susan is a very hardworking woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. Susan will use the extra income she will get to repay the loan and increase her farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm inouts.

loans.name: Niko

texts.en:
Niko wants to buy some agricultural land and the loan he is requesting from you will help him achieve this goal. His focus is on agriculture and he wants to expand on it since he knows for certain that someone can make good money out of it. 

Niko is 36-years-old and married; he’s got two children, aged 14 and 11 who both go to school. While he and his wife do agriculture for a living, his retired mother, who lives with them, pitches in with the family. 

Niko and his wife collect medicinal plants and flowers that they sell for cash. They cultivate and sell seasonal veggies and some grains such as wheat and corn. They've also got fruit trees such as pears, cherries, persimmons, walnuts and also grapes. Niko lives in a hilly countryside area known  for multiple sources of water.

loans.use: to buy some agricultural land as he knows for certain that focusing on agriculture is the best way to go.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina, is 52 years old and a resident of Poblacion, Sibutad, Philippines. She has 2 kids, one of whom is in college.  She owns a "sari-sari store" (small grocery store) that forms part of her house, and her neighbors are her clients. 

Since she has a college student to support, she has decided to improve her small business to support her children. So she has requested a loan at Paglaum MPC in the amount of 7,000 PHP. Aside from the financial assistance, she also receives add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr: Rosine est une femme de 38 ans célibataire sans enfant. Elle a eu une double formation couture et coiffure ensuite elle ouvert un petit atelier dans lequel elle pratiques ses deux formations. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son matériel de couture et acheter les mèches ainsi que les produits cosmétiques. ceci augmentera sa rapidité, la satisfaction de sa clientèle ainsi que son chiffre d'affaire et son bénéfice. bénéfice qui seront réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Rosine is 38 years old and single. She has no children. 

She is trained in sewing and hairstyling and has a small studio where she performs her two trades. She is asking for a loan to buy sewing supplies, hair extensions, and cosmetics. This will increase her speed, her clients' satisfaction, her revenues, and her profits. 

She will reinvest her profits in her business to help it grow.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies, hair extensions, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Miriam wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in her area and to raise her profits.

For that reason with the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Sadik

texts.en:
Sadik, who is seeking help to buy another dairy cow, is photographed above in his cows’ stable. His goal has been to have a farm and he has slowly been adding one cow at the time to his herd.  Surprisingly, his cows have given birth only to male calves, thus, he’s been obliged to add cows by buying.

Sadik is 49 years old and a married father of two, 23 and 18 years of age.  He's been in agriculture and livestock for a long time to earn a living, and he has enjoyed it so far.  

He also sells to the farmer’s market in the nearby city of Korca. He sells peppers, tomatoes, onions and potatoes and he’s been doing well. His region is best known as the largest producer of potatoes, onions, beans and apple and quince fruits.

loans.use: to achieve his goal of establishing a cow farm.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 46, a widow in Sindangan, ZND, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. She never gets tired tending her store everyday. 

Wilma  is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without any records of default. Now, she is borrowing another loan to pay for inventories of soap, shampoo, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc to sustain her family's living. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc to sustain her family's living.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is married with one child. She is 68 years old and lives in Ventura, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. 

Trinidad is a farmer and grows corn and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 50 years. She has requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals and expand her corn production. 

Trinidad has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Trinidad hopes to harvest more corn and vegetable crops which her grandchildren deliver to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for corn.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda, age 52, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with three kids, and her husband is a motorcycle driver which they rent daily. 

The store is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  Rosenda keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.  Rosenda believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will do well and beat the competition.  

Rosenda has reached her fourth year as a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 4,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of being a member in good standing. "It's already tested", she said. 

She is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there she could afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock in bulk for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 years old. She is married to Ezekiel and together they have been blessed with three children aged nine, seven and five.

Elizabeth is a fruits and vegetables vendor, a business she has done for the last five years.  She earns a monthly income of Kshs. 20,000.

Elizabeth has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 10,000, which she will use to add more stock of fruits and vegetables.

With the anticipated profits, Elizabeth will be able to pay for the school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to increase her income.

loans.use: to add stock of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz en su venta de refrescos le ha ido muy bien con su credikiva anterior, pues su capital de trabajo se incrementó logrando con ese dinero comprar cajas de refrescos y bebidas insumos con los que aumentó la productividad de sus comidas rápidas  e impactó con su venta la miscelánea. Desde que recibió su credikiva, los ingresos de su negocio han mejorado, y con ello los familiares. Por eso dice a sus financiadores: Muchas gracias por este apoyo, el objetivo es seguir mejorando los ingresos familiares.“   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una vez más,  insumos para elaborar comidas rápidas, cajas de cervezas y refrescos, con los cuales estará preparada para la llegada de las fiestas más comerciales del año: Las navidades y la llegada del año nuevo. Su credikiva impactará su negocio pues podrá comprar al por mayor y de contado lo que hará que pueda obtener mejores precios y poder ser mucho más competitiva y despedir el año en familia y acompañada de sus clientes-vecinos, como dice la canción de la Billo!s Caracas Boys :  "Entre pitos y matracas entre música y sonrisa el reloj ya nos avisa  que ha llegado un año mas...Las mujeres y los hombres un besito nos daremos, entre todos cantaremos llenos de felicidad...Vamos todos a cantar".
texts.en:
Luz's refreshment stand has done very well with her last kiva loan.  Her working capital has increased, and with this money she has bought crates of drinks and refreshments which increased the productivity of her fast-food stand and impacted her sale of miscellaneous goods.  Since she received her kiva loan, her business income has increased and with that her family's income as well.  For this she says to her lenders: thank you very much for this support, her goal is to continue increasing her family's income.

She is currently applying for a new kiva loan, with which she will once again buy goods to make more fast foods, and crates of beer and beverages to sell.  This will prepare her for the arrival of the most profitable celebrations of the year: Christmas and the New Year.  Her kiva loan will impact her business in that she will be able buy by wholesale and retail.  This will make her able to set better prices and be much more competitive and end the year with family and surrounded by her customers/neighbors.  

As it says in the song by the Billo's Caracas Boys: "Among whistles and rattles, among music and smiles, the clock tells us that another year has arrived...the women and men give us a kiss, and together we sing full of happiness...let's all sing."

loans.use: to purchase goods to make fast foods, and crates of beer and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is a married woman with 3 children, each of whom is in school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

With the 50,000 KES loan that Phyllis is requesting, she wishes to start a business selling clothes. She will purchase bales of clothes for re-sale. 

Phyllis decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business and support her family. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 65 years old, is married with four adult children. She is a resident of Lusot, Baliangao, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than a decade. Planting corn and other crops is her primary source of livelihood. 

She became a member of Paglaum MPC in July 2000. Recently, Josephine decided to apply for a loan to buy additional fertilizer for her corn and crops. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell.

In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for corn.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 3 children. 

In Nakuru town, Mary has a retail shop, a business which she has been running for the past 7 years. 

Mary plans to use this loan to buy more inventory stock of milk, sugar, rice, flour, beans, and cooking oil. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy more inventory to sell in her shop.

This is Mary's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to grow her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of milk, rice, flour, and cooking oil to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is a Ugandan man, married and aged 30. He lives in Kagadi where he has operated a wholesale and retail shop since 2008 to earn income. He hopes to grow his business despite high competition from similar businesses. 

Since he is hard working, Jerome is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and many more items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and many more items to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 52-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a clinical officer who has served for 26 years and she also owns a clinic to supplement her income. 

Alice is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to attain her vision of building a permanent home for her family and educating her children. Alice appreciates Kiva services for she has been able to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatum is a married woman who has six children, all of whom attend school. For the past ten years, she has operated a cashew-nut-selling business. Fatum sells at the market to her neighbors and town-dwellers and her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She owns a house with electricity and no running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Fatum decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and educate her children.

Fatuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, living with her family in a poor area in Taiz city, Yemen. She is from a very humble family in Taiz. Fatima and her family live in a rented house which lacks a lot of home appliances and furniture, and most of them are very old and need to change. Her husband is the sole breadwinner for the family and she works as a housewife. 

Fatima wants to purchase home appliances  to improve the living condition inside the house, but the income of her husband is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to purchase home appliances.

loans.use: buy home appliances

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 27 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. She does farming in Nakuru town and has been in the farming business for 7 years. 

Jane will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is Jane's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her farming and be successful.

loans.use: buy seeds & fertilizer

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old. She is married to Samson and together they have been blessed with one daughter who is 3 years old.  Samson provides additional income for his family.

Diana runs a money transfer business commonly referred to as 'M-pesa' in Kenya.  She has done this business for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KSH 15,000.

Diana has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya for KSH. 30,000 which she will use to add float for her M-pesa business.

With the anticipated profits, Diana will be able to secure enough for school fees in preparation for her child's education. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to increase her income as well as see her business expanding form one level to the other.

loans.use: to add working capital for her M-pesa business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 28 years old. She is single and blessed with three children of 3, 14 and 25 years.  Edith runs a money transfer business referred in Kenya as 'M-pesa' which she has done for the last 3 years.

Edith has requested for a loan with VisionFund Kenya of KSH 45,000 which she will use to add/increase float for her money transfer business.This will ensure her business is always running and all customers are attended to in order to incur extra profits.

With the anticipated profits, Edith will be able to pay school fees for her school-going children as well as repay her loan. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loans.  Her hopes and dreams for the future is to increase her income.

loans.use: add working capital to her money transfer business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town and has been in the business for 4 years. He is 30 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. 

James will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business as well as repay the loan. 

This is James' second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to be successful in his business and be able to live a happy life with his family.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 27 years old, hard working and married with three children, two of whom attend school. Innocent deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of rice, beans and maize. He supplements his income by riding a motorcycle for transport. He desires to expand and grow his business, but his desire is limited by price fluctuations and seasonality. He will use this loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a forty-three-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her business for the last nine years is renting out gowns, traditional wear.  Her business challenge is mishandling of her merchandise by clients.  

Lucy is a loving mother with a dream of educating her children and expanding her business to a level of handling big and many events. Lucy needs this loan to buy more decorations and gowns for renting.  Lucy attributes her success to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: buy decorations and gowns to rent

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. Jessica is a forty-one-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years she as been an accountant and also does farming to supplement her income. She was inspired by the conduct of other people in her profession and her vision is to go for further studies and become a certified public accountant. Jessica intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu is married woman with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and  piped water. 

Tunu operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With this KSH 40,000 loan Tunu wants to purchase stocks soft drinks to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy soft drinks

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Ash is a married woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

Ash has been in a retail business for the past two years, selling food items in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation of goods from the wholesaler.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With this KSH 40,000 loan Ash wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Pasho

texts.en:
Pasho is 51 and a member of the ethnic communityof Romani.  He is married and has a grown-up child. 

Pasho and his wife have been re-selling used items, most often clothing, and the loan he is requesting from you will help Pasho stock up on such inventory items to re-sell. 

The biggest Roma/Eqyptian market in Albania has been built in the city of Elbasan where Pasho resides. The market that was there before got in a fire and members of both communities built a new one with their own contributions and the city built another one also for them.  People from all over the countryvisit this market.  Some of the items there are used ones and some are brand new ones that are out of fashion, such items are bought from neighbouring countries. Due to the poverty level, thrifty items are very much in demand in the country.

loans.use: buy used items to resell

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a forty-eight-year-old woman, divorced, with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Madina operates a soda depot where she earns income to look after her family and pay her children's school fees. She has dreams of both educating her children to the degree level, and building a good home for her family. 

Madina is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital. She is a hardworking woman who is requesting a loan so she can buy cement and sand and pay the labor costs to construct a residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for construction labor to build a home.

loans.name: Esad

texts.en:
Esad chose to be photographed next to a mini-van that he wants to buy with your financial help.

Esad is 55 and a married father of two, a 10-year-old and an 8-year-old, and they live in a village in southeastern Albania. So far, he has been practicing agriculture/livestock to earn a living for his family. Currently, he’s got two milk cows and 20 goats; he sells dairy products to the farmer’s market of a nearby town. In addition to this, he plants mostly beans, onions, potatoes and tomatoes, and has some fruit trees, including persimmons, plums, quinces, etc.

The minivan that he wants to buy, he will use to transport mostly schoolchildren and teachers, yet there would be no limitation to other travelers. Note that  many teachers who teach in the rural areas live in the cities/towns, and also not every village has a school; thus, the traveling of these people is on a consistent basis.

loans.use: to buy a minivan to transport mostly school children and teachers, and travelers during the summer or weekends

loans.name: Kira

texts.ru: Кира, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Киры средне-специальное образование, много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 4 дойные коровы. Супруг и дети с радостью помогают Кире в ведении ее бизнеса. Экологически чистое, вкусное, домашнее молоко она реализует на ежедневной основе, оно пользуется большим спросом, поэтому Кира решила увеличить поголовье дойных коров. Поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Кира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kira is 45 years old, married, and is the mother of three children.  She has a specialized secondary level education and she has had a dairy business for a long time.  Kira has four dairy cows, and her husband and children are happy to help her run the business.  She sells good tasting and ecologically friendly home-style milk on a daily basis.  There is strong demand for her milk, so Kira has decided to purchase additional cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

To this end, Kira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy dairy cows so she can sell more milk.  Kira plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows in order to increase the volume of eco-friendly milk sales

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged 47 and is a single mother of seven children; four attend school. She deals in crop production, mainly growing cassava and maize. This is supplemented by income from waragi (local brew) selling. 

She desires to complete her residential house and pay school fees for her children. She will use the loan facility to pay for materials like sand to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to pay for materials like sand to complete her residential house.

loans.name: Manzuramo

texts.en:
Manzuramo is a 36 year old resident of Bohtar district. She lives with her parents and sister. Manzuramo is a widow and has no children. 

Manzuramo is engaged in the livestock business with her father; she breeds cattle. Manzuramo likes her business, because it is hard to find a good job in the rural area. 

Now Manzuramo is requesting a loan to do home repairs before the coming of the cold weather. She did not have enough money to complete the repairs and she hopes for your support to complete them. With the loan amount she will buy building materials. 

Please help Manzuramo, she realizes that their house may not  get through the winter and she needs the money soon. She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a home renovation.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Leah, a very industrious, honest and hard-working woman from the Kericho area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley. 

Leah has been farming for the past 15 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practising mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Leah is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. 

Although Leah makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kericho area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Leah could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Leah, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Leah believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. 

Increased profits will allow Leah to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru: Чынаркуль 53 года, замужем, есть 3 детей, сын живет с ней. У Чынаркуль средне-специальное образование, она работает в больнице, но так как зарплата чрезвычайно мала, Чынаркуль занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 2,70 ГА, где она выращивает ячмень и эспарцет, реализуя свою продукцию оптовым покупателям. Чынаркуль известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынаркуль обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Чынаркуль планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Chynarkul is 53 years old, married, and she has three children.  Her son still lives with her.  Chynarkul has a specialized secondary level education and she works in a hospital.  However, since her salary is extremely small, she also runs an agricultural business.  She owns two cows and 10 sheep, and she also has 2.70 ha of land where she raises barley and sainfoin, which she sells to wholesalers.  Chynarkul is well known as a principled, honest, clean-living, and reliable woman.

In order to develop her business, Chynarkul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy four bull-calves which she will fatten up and sell.  Chynarkul plans to use the profits from her loan in further business development and to save up for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase four bull-calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ineza

texts.en:
Ineza is a 51 year old, married woman, from the Zestaponi district. She lives with her husband, who works at a private company and has a fixed salary of 400 GEL. The family ears a living with this income only and that is really hardly enough to meet even basic needs. 

In spite of her high education, Ineza can't find any stable job and decided to start her own business. She requested a loan from local financial institutions and was rejected several times for lack of experience and her financial condition. The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 1,500 USD for starting a trading business. 

Ineza will rent a counter at the local store and will sell clothing and jewellery, transferred from Turkey where there is a worldwide market. She will generate her own income and do her bit for the family's welfare.

Ineza is looking forward to your help and kindness and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to start trading with clothing and jewelry and generate her own income

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora de 33 años de edad, esta soltera y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad que aún no estudia, solo su hijo vive con ella.

Dora es comerciante pequeño, vende bocadillos típicos al lado de su casa, papas fritas, pasteles de carne, tostadas de plátano, yuca sancochada y frita, refresco de horchata y demás, desde hace 3 años,  es muy conocida en la zona por la calidad de su producto.

El préstamo lo necesitas para comprar leña, azúcar, sal, maíz, frijol papas, plátano y demás para tener de reservas para la época navideña y así mantener estable el negocio. Dora piensa en un futuro tener una pequeña tienda de productos varios.
texts.en:
Dora, 33, is single and has a 3-year-old son who doesn't go to school yet. Only her son lives with her.

Dora is a small businesswoman. For three years she has been selling typical sandwiches beside her house as well as chips; meat pasties; plantain chips; parboiled and fried cassava;  a soft drink made form tiger nuts and so on. She is very well known in the area for the quality of her products.

She needs the loan to buy wood; sugar; salt; corn; beans; potatoes; plantain and so on, to have reserve supplies for the Christmas period and be able to keep the business stable. Dora is thinking about having a small shop with various products in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood; sugar; salt; corn; beans; potatoes; plantain and so on.

loans.name: Zhypargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргуль 43 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование - средне-специальное. Уже много лет она занимается бизнесом по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Жыпаргуль есть 5 коров и 15 овец, на участке мерою 1,5 Га посажен клевер. Совокупный среднемесячный доход Жыпаргуль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Супруг и дети активно помогают Жыпаргуль по хозяйству. Зимой она содержит скот в сараях, летом выгоняет на пастбище. Жыпаргуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят ей и дальше развивать бизнес и улучшать благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Zhypargul is 43 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has vocational education. She has had her own livestock breeding business for many years already. Currently Zhypargul has five cows and 15 sheep on her farm, and she grows clover on a plot of land of 1.5 hectares. Zhypargul's total monthly income is on average 20,000 som (KGS). 

Zhypargul's husband and children actively help her with the business. During the winter she keeps the livestock in her barn, in the summer they graze on the pasture. 

Zhypargul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep to fatten and sell. The income from the loan will allow her to both develop her business further and also to increase the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Roepchand

texts.en: Roepchand is very glad with the support he got from Kiva lenders and thanks all of you. He has repaid his loan fully and on time and approaches for another loan of SRD 8,000 for continuing rice production. With the profits of last season, he could save some money for purchasing his own plot.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Selina, a 73-year-old, very hard working, honest and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in the lush hills of Kitale, in the rift valley region of Kenya. Selina passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 28 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Selina has identified a free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and milk prices in the recent past have been going up. Selina, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she has learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Selina said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Selina hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her 10 children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Redemter

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Redemter, 57 a mother of four who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and farming. Redemter hails from Kitale, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns, which boosts crop production in the area. Redemter, being someone who is very ambitious and always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hard-working mother, Redemter has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. 

Redemter detests living in conditions of poverty, and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 66,600 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market, which will lead to improved cash flow. Improved cash flow means that profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school. Through your loan Redemter will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also those of people living within the area. Redemter is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Katweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Betty is a Ugandan married woman, aged 39 years and living in Kagadi. She has five children, aged 18 to 4 years, and four attend school. 

She has been selling waragi (the local brew) and charcoal and practicing agriculture since 2008 to generate income to educate her children. She hopes to grow her business despite price fluctuations. 

Betty is requesting a loan to buy the local brew (waragi) and charcoal for selling. She is a member of the Katweyombeke Group, in which each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy the local brew (waragi) and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 30-year-old female, married with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has operated a bar since 2009 to earn a living. She also practices farming, growing crops such as maize, beans, rice and cassava flour. She has a dream of expanding her business but is faced with a challenge of competition and closing late in the night. Florence requests a loan to buy sodas, beers and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beers and spirits to sell

loans.name: Altin

texts.en:
A loan in an amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek will help Altin to buy a milk cow.

Altin is 27 years old and has a 3-year-old child; they live in rural northern Albania. 

As of now, Altin has two cows, yet one of them has gotten older; thus, it doesn’t produce milk anymore. The new cow that he plans to buy will replace the old one. 

In addition to selling dairy and baby calves to the locals, he owns 6,500 meters of agricultural land where he plants in large quantities corn and seasonal veggies. Added to this, he’s been happy because about six months back he started working with some construction company as a journeyman.  

Altin immigrated twice in Sweden and Belgium, yet he was "not lucky," as per his quotation, and then he tried Greece, which went well until the economy went down and he was forced to come back to his village and settle there.

loans.use: to replace an older and unproductive cow with a new one

loans.name: Azida

texts.ru: Азида, 50 лет, вдова, трое детей. У Азиды среднее образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). У Азиды в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 10 овец и 2 лошади. Также на участке 0,80 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления.  Летом Азида отгоняет скот на пастбище, зимой содержит в сараях. По хозяйству помогает сын. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса небольшая и ее не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому посоветовавшись с сыном, она решила, в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратиться в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит Азиде постепенно улучшать уровень жизни ее семьи.
texts.en:
Azida is 50 years old, a widow, and she has three children.  Azida has a secondary level education, and for many years she run an agricultural business.   She has two cows, two calves, 10 sheep and two horses.  She also has 0.80 ha of land where she grows corn for use on her farmstead.  In the summer, Azida puts her cattle out to pasture and in the winter keeps them in barns.  Her son helps her with the business.  Her profit isn't very big and it's not enough to lead a decent life.

After consulting with her son, Azida decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan in order to develop her business.  She has requested 50,000 som (KGS) to buy calves.  Azida plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her herd, which, little by little, will allow her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves for fattening and resale in order to increase her family's income

loans.name: Ajileo

texts.en:
Ajileo lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hardworking man, aged 37. He is a father of four children, and three attend school. 

He sells spare parts for motorcycles and repairs them. He supplements his income with farming. He hopes to improve the welfare of his family and pay school fees for his children. 

Ajileo will use the loan facility to buy more spare parts to sell. However, his major problem is inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Heman

texts.en:
Heman thanks all his Kiva lenders once again for their help in realizing his long-terms dreams.

He has repaid his loan on time and could save some money for his daughter to study. He has also bought a motorcycle to go to his rice fields. 

Heman wants to continue with his rice cultivation and needs another loan of SRD 12,000 for purchasing inputs for his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like diesel and fertilizers for his rice production.

loans.name: Aizhan

texts.ru: Айжан 37 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей, самому старшему 19 лет. У Айжан среднее образование, на протяжении 17 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айжан есть 6 коров, 2 лошади, также у нее есть 0,34 ГА собственной и 3,0 ГА арендованной поливной земли, на которой она выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айжан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Айжан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aizhan is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children, the eldest of whom is 19 years old.  Aizhan has a secondary level education and for the last 17 years, she has been in the farming and cattle business.  Today, Aizhan has six cows and two horses.  She also owns 0.34 ha of land and rents another 3.0 ha where she grows potatoes, grain crops, and sainfoin for both using on her farmstead and for selling.

With an aim to further developing her business, Aizhan applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle.  Aizhan plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd of cattle and to eventually save up enough money for home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Radjinderpersad

texts.en:
Radjinderpersad feels very blessed when he sees how the Kiva lenders are helping him and other rice farmers with financing their costs. He thanks all of you from the bottom of his heart.

He did his best to pay his loan fully and succeeded. Radinderpersad saved some money for buying a new plot, but that is not enough. He will continue rice production so he can save more. He approaches for another loan of SRD 10,000 for purchasing fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mahinder

texts.en:
Mahinder is very happy with the support from Kiva lenders and thanks all of them for their help.

He has fully repaid his previous loan and was able to save some money to help with both his own rice plots and his children's tuition.

Mahinder is asking Kiva lenders for more help to purchase diesel, pesticides, and fertilizers so he can continue with his rice production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to continue farming rice.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 55 years old, and a hardworking father of six children. He operates a retail shop, mainly selling general merchandise and textiles. He hopes to develop and expand his business so as to improve the general welfare of his family.

He will use the loan facility to buy more soap and sugar for selling.

loans.use: to buy more soap and sugar for selling.

loans.name: Twekambe Paacwa Group

texts.en:
Hillary is a Ugandan married man who is 28 years old and has one child, who is four years old. He lives in Kagadi, where he deals in produce selling, especially maize and rice, to earn him an income. He also earns from a drug shop and farming. He hopes to grow his business and educate his children with the returns, despite price fluctuations.

Hillary is requesting a loan to buy maize and rice for selling. He is a member of Twekambe Paacwa Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice for selling

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam and Myassar are two hardworking ladies who are trying to help support their families. 

They decided to start a business together by selling makeup products, accessories, and clothing. 

Today Mariam and Myassar have applied for a loan in order to purchase a new collection of winter clothes for them to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oemardath

texts.en:
Oemardath thanks all Kiva lenders for understanding his need for a loan and is very glad to know how Kiva works with so many lenders.

He repaid his loan on time and could save some money for his wedding. Oemardath has now approached Seva MFI for another loan of SRD 7,500 to buy fertilizers and pesticides so that he can save more for his family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Kiguhyo Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Alice is a 38-year-old married Ugandan woman living in Kagadi with eight children; six attend school. She has been selling alcohol and farming since 2012 for a better standard of living. She hopes to grow her business and educate her children despite price fluctuations and the general unpredictable weather changes affecting farmers. 

Alice intends to use a loan to buy maize and beans for planting. She is a member of Kiguhyo Tweimukye where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for planting
