loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts for selling

loans.name: Natete Tukwatanize Farmers Group

texts.en:
Kedress is a 35-year-old lady living in Kagadi, Uganda with three children. She has been selling produce since 2000 and also sells alcohol to generate income. She hopes to have a well-off family in spite of a lot of competition in her business.

Kedress intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans and alcohol for selling. She is a member of Natete Tukwatanize Farmers Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and alcohol for selling

loans.name: Blanca Roxana

texts.es: Blanca tiene  32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 6 años y 3 años de edad, y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Blanca se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde desde hace mucho tiempo. Blanca desea construir el corredor de su vivienda  y repellar las paredes de la misma por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada, pines, madera, etc.
texts.en:
Blanca is 32 years old. She lives in her own house with her life partner, her two daughters who are 6 and 3 years old, and her son who is 12 years old. For a very long time, Blanca has made a living raising and selling broiler chickens. 

Blanca wishes to build a hallway and to plaster the walls of her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, corrugated metal sheets, pins, wood, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, corrugated metal sheets, pins, wood, etc. to build a hallway and to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 5 neumáticos que necesita su vehículo, él tenía unos ahorros pero los utilizo porque su esposa se enfermó, cada neumático tiene un costo de $100.

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sabe que lo lograran si él se mantiene trabajando, por lo que espera su negocio se mantenga siempre estable.
texts.en:
This loan will be used to purchase five tires needed for his vehicle. He had some savings but he had to use those because his wife was sick. Each of the tires costs $100. 

His dream is that his children will finish their studies. He knows they will succeed if he can continue working. He hopes that his business will always remain stable.

loans.use: purchase five tires needed for his vehicle.

loans.name: Rayan

texts.en: Rayan is feeling very happy and blessed with the help of Kiva lenders and thanks them a lot. He has repaid his loan on time and with the profits he was able to save some money for his tractor. This is not enough, so Rayan will continue rice production. For this, he asks again for help purchasing fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ukux Kem Group

texts.en:
Totonicapan is a rural city in the Western Highlands of Guatemala where the indigenous Maya speak K’iche. The area is also known for its hot springs.  

Ten ladies form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Ukux Kem” – Heart of Weaving.
  
At their October meeting this year, the very satisfied members were pleased to report that their loans, which had been funded by Kiva investors, had been paid in full and on time!  Now, the ten members, two who are new and eight from the previous cycle, are applying for new loans, hoping that Kiva investors will once again provide the financing.  
  
Francisca Serapia, a member of the group, is beginning her third loan cycle.  She is single, lives with her large family and has eight brothers.  As one of the eldest members, she is responsible for helping to support her family.  Francisca’s business is the making and selling of napkins - a dozen of which she sells every eight days.  She is requesting a new loan in order to purchase a variety of threads in many colors and textures.  These threads will help her grow her business. She wants to take advantage of the demand now and knows that as the end of the year approaches, the demand for her product will decrease.  

Francisca, along with the other nine members of the “Ukux Kem.” appreciates the confidence of Kiva investors, and thanks them for the funding they give.  Because of their generosity, many women are able to have and maintain successful businesses. During their monthly meetings they also benefit from non-formal educational training in topics like business management, accounting, customer service, self-esteem and empowerment.  The ladies of “Ukux Kem” feel blessed to have the support of Kiva investors.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of threads in many colors and textures

loans.name: Burooro Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Fred is a married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with 6 children. He sells produce and alcohol since 2002 for his daily income. He hopes to grow his business and educate his children in spite of a lot of competition from similar businessmen and the high cost of transporting his produce to his customers.

Fred is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans for selling. He is a member of Burooro Tweimukye Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a new cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Red Bank, located in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He is eager to join the cacao industry because he sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. Jose believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop that is good for the environment and will help develop his local community. 

Jose wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he might expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted, high-yielding, disease resistant cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase 1200 cacao seedlings

loans.name: Utatlan Group

texts.en:
Santa Cruz del Quiche, in western Guatemala, is the location of the Utatlan Trust Bank, which in July 2013 received loans through Kiva. These women have been very active and very responsibly have paid back their loans. The group is currently seeking new loans in order to invest in their micro-businesses. The businesses consist of the manufacture and sale of textiles, cosmetics sales, medical sales and food sales, as well as other businesses.

One of the group members is Evelia, who is 30 years old and the single mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Evelia’s business is the sale of parts. Four months ago, she was able to buy a small coffee shop. The coffee shop has had so many customers that she is encouraged to apply for a new loan so she can buy and prepare new food items, drinks and “atole” (a hot corn and masa (dough)-based beverage) which will make her menu more diverse. The new menu items will also help her to continue to expand her clientele. 

The women of the Utatlan Trust Bank report that they are eager to enter into a new loan cycle. They are also looking forward to receiving the non-formal educational training that helps them to increase their intellectual development. These training sessions are provided at the monthly Trust Bank meetings by the Trust Bank officer are part of Friendship Bridge’s “Micro-credit Plus” program of subjects such as business management, customer service and accounting – all of which are very important for the success of their businesses. They are all very grateful to the Kiva investors who have helped them become successful!

loans.use: To purchase food items, drinks and “atole” to make her menu more diverse.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Mayrambi

texts.ru: Майрамби женщина ответственная, добропорядочная и деятельная. Она по профессии портниха и уже два года как предоставляет свои услуги швеи. Майрамби замужем, ей 37 лет. Ее муж работает в Государственном комитете национальной безопасности. У них четверо дочерей и один сын. Майрамби со своей большой семьей живет в районе Вахш. Все ее дети еще учатся. Старшей дочери Мехрангез 16 лет. Она в этом году поступила в Медицинский колледж своего района. Ее ежегодное обучение по контракту составляет в национальной валюте 3315 TJS. Майрамби собирается оплатить за учебу дочери за 4 года вперед, однако не имеет финансовой возможности, чтобы внести такую оплату. Майрамби единственное решение видит в получении кредита. Она узнала, что в ХУМО есть кредит на образование по низким процентным ставкам. Поэтому Майрамби обратилась за этим выгодным кредитом. Она просит 3000 долларов США на оплату за 4-летнее обучение дочери вперед, а также для купли необходимых учебных принадлежностей для дочери. Ваша поддержка им сейчас очень важна!
texts.en:
Mayrambi is a responsible, respectable and active woman. She is a cleaner by profession, and for two years she has also provided a sewing service. Mayrambi is married and 37 years old. Her husband works in the State Committee of National Security. They have four daugthers and one son. Mayrambi and her large family live in the Vakhsh region. All the children go to school. 

Mayrambi's eldest daughter is 16 years old and started the Medical college in their region this year. Her annual educational tuition is 3,315 somoni (TJS). Mayrambi decided to pay for her daughter's tuition for four years forward. She does however not have the financial opportunity to make this payment. The only solution Mayrambi could see was to get a loan. She knew that MLO Humo have loans for education at low interest rates. Therefore, Mayrambi applied for this favorable loan. 

She requests 3,000 US dollar to pay for the four year tuition for her daughter, and also to purchase necessary study supplies for her. Your support to them is very important now!

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition for four years ahead, and also to purchase study supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cucumber and tomato seeds, and fertilizers, in order to grow organic vegetables and increase the income of her family

loans.name: Clelia  Lissette

texts.es:
Clelia es un señora  casada , con un pequeño hijo a su cargo al que le proporciona su ayuda para su desarrollo , de profesion Lic en Trabajo Social y se desmpeña como agente de comunicacion trabaja con niños de zonas rurales que patrocina la organizacion donde ella labora desde hace mas de 2 años.
actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar  su primer financiamiento  con ceprodel , para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda como es repello y pintura del cuarto de habitacion de su pequeño hijo dichi financiamineto lo utilizaria en la compra de cemento , arena, pintura de agua y pago de  mano de obra. lo que vendria a mejorar sus condicones de vida
texts.en:
Clelia is a married woman with a small son in her custody,  to whom she gives support in his development.  She has a  BA in Social Work and works as a communications agent with rural children who are sponsored by the organization where she has worked for over 2 years.

Recently, this lady arrived at the office of Ceprodel to request her first loan with Ceprodel.  She wants to improve her house conditions and is plastering and painting her small child's room.  Such financing will be used in the purchase of cement, sand, water based paint and payment of labor. This will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, water based paint and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mary. She is married and has four children aged 8, 10, 15, and 23. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her and helps with the house chores.

In 1998, Mary established her textiles business. She began her business just to be self reliant and to help her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,250,000 every month from this business.

Mary would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more cotton and lace. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 2,000,000.

In the future, Mary plans to expand the business to other area of the town. She hopes to be able to educate the children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bales of cotton and lace

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Shalom” is located in the town of Santa Cruz del Quiche and is in the Department of Quiche, north-west of the capital, Guatemala City. Quiche has a very large indigenous Maya population who speak K’iche.

Ricarda is one of seven enthusiastic members of the Shalom Trust Bank. The group is filled with the desire to excel in order to provide a better future for their children. Each of the women in the group has on average about four children. They are requesting loans that will be invested in businesses such as selling cosmetics, new and used clothing, food, tortillas, and several other kinds of businesses.

Ricarda is 43 years old and has four children, who are aged between 10 and 19. She sells cosmetics and clothing, and her business supports her family financially. Ricarda is currently applying for a loan to buy an inventory of clothing for men, women and children. As the end of the year approaches, it is the season when people usually buy clothes. Ricarda wants to invest a portion of her loan to purchase more cosmetics as these have also been very profitable for her.

The seven women of the Shalom Trust Bank appreciate the support of Kiva investors as the investors’ contributions to the Trust Bank make their futures better and a reality. Along with the loans, the women also benefit from the training programs offered by the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank officer, where they discuss health issues, leadership, empowerment, self-esteem and hygiene. Other important topics for their businesses are marketing, budgeting, customer service and accounting. The importance of these training sessions is the strengthening of the group members' knowledge that then empowers them to succeed.

loans.use: To buy an inventory of clothing for men, women and children and to buy cosmetics

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 65 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. Сейчас Айгул на пенсии и занимается полеводством на собственном участке мерою 1,0 ГА, где выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Свой бизнес она начала 22 года назад с 20,000 сом. У Айгул также есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Айгул составляет около 20,000 сом. По характеру она человек очень честный, целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от бизнеса Айгул собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие ее хозяйства.
texts.en:
Aigul is 65 years old, married and has five children. She is currently on a pension and works with field crop cultivation on her own plot of land of 1.0 hectares. Here she grows sweet corn and clover. She started her business 22 years ago with 20,000 som (KGS). Aigul also has two cows, two calves and 20 sheep. The monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). Aigul is a very honest, purposeful and hard working person by nature. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Aigul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase heifers to increase the number of livestock. Aigul has decided to direct the income from the business to further developing her farm.

loans.use: to purchase heifers in order to increase the headcount of livestock

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children who are still in school. She has been running a pharmacy business for seven years now. She works from 7.30 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Zuhura's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase  the pharmacy stock and has successfully repaid all her loans.  Zuhura used the profits to pay school fees, and bought a TV set, a plot of land, and two cupboards for the kitchen and for clothes: she also covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy fast-moving medicines and to restock out-of-stock medicines. She dreams of having a big pharmacy. 

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group "Karafuu" which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast-moving medicines and to restock out-of-stock medicines.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo is a new cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Red Bank, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He is eager to join the cacao industry because he sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. He believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop that is both good for the environment and will help develop his local community. 

Mateo wants to secure a Kiva microloan so that he might expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted, high-yielding, disease-resistant cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase 1,200 cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Karachach

texts.ru: Карачач 56 лет, замужем, все дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У Карачач - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Карачач, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 3 коровы, 10 овец и 2 лошади. Также в сезон Карачач занимается полеводством, на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,20 ГА Карачач выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). Карачач обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) в целях развития своей животноводческой деятельности, а именно для покупки коров. Скот Карачач намерена перепродавать на местном скотном рынке, доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что приведет к получению большей прибыли и позволит построить сарай для скота. Также она хочет накопить средства на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en:
Karachach is 56 years old and married. All her children are adults and independent. Karachach has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding for a period of 20 years. 

Thanks to her purposefulness and hard work, Karachach currently has three cows, 10 sheep and two horses on her farm. She also works with field crop cultivation on her own plot of land of 1.20 hectares. During the season she grows barley. The monthly income is around 16,000 som (KGS). 

Karachach turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) with an aim to develop her livestock breeding business, specifically to purchase cows. She intends to resell the livestock at the local livestock market. 

Karachach will direct the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, which will lead to a larger income and allow her to build a livestock barn. She would also like to save money for her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase cows for fattening and reselling

loans.name: 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El grupo “23 de Octubre” está en su Octavo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de ellas necesitan una mayor capacitación para poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sabina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco más para mejorar sus ingresos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante a todos sus clientes. Es una persona que sabe lo que hace, y es por eso que se gano el aprecio de sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group “23 de Octubre” (October 23rd) is in its eighth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of them are committed to working and helping one another so that they can move forward. They have taken the poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that three of them are in need of more training so that they can improve their lives.

One of the members is Sra. Sabina, whose survey indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. This means that she will need to work a bit harder to improve her earnings. Sabina sells food that she prepares herself. She sells as a street vendor to all of her customers. Sabina is a person who is knowledgeable at what she does. For this reason, she has gained the appreciation of her customers.

Sabina is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and other supplies so that she can continue her sales as before.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for rubber bowls, cool man and lunch bowls.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es: Noel de 56 años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza por salir adelante ya que desde hace más de 20 años se gana la vida como transportista realizando viajes en el departamento y sus alrededores, por lo que es muy conocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora. Él habita en vivienda propia desde hace 16 años en los que ha procreado junto a su esposa 5 hijos de 19, 17, 14, 13 y 8 años de edad, de los cuales uno le ha dado 1 nieto de 6 años de edad por lo que se siente muy feliz. Noel es un hombre que siempre busca la manera de ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de la cocina y así lograr que este brinde una mejor protección a sus pertenencias para que no se mojen cuando llueve.
texts.en: Noel, age 56, is a man who works hard to get ahead in life. For more than 20 years he has earned a living as a transportation provider, making trips in the department where he lives and its surroundings. He is very well-known as an honest and hard-working person. He has lived in his own home for 16 years, and together with his wife he has 5 children, aged 19, 17, 14, 13 and 8. One of them has given him a 6-year-old grandchild, which makes him very happy. Noel is a person who is always looking for ways to improve his standard of living and that of his family. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to replace the roof of the family's kitchen. The new roof will provide more protection to their belongings, so that they will not get wet when it rains.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the kitchen roof in his home.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 21 años junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad, ella tiene una familia numerosa ya que también vive con ellos su yerno y su nieto de 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza por salir adelante ya que desde hace 2 años se gana la vida como cocinera de un restaurante de playa, pero además los miembros de su familia también apoyan para los gastos del hogar. María es una mujer visionaria que siempre busca lo mejor para su familia por lo que ha decidido construir el servicio sanitario de su vivienda, pero al no contar con la solidez económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y lámina para construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda sabiendo que apoyada en su empleo podrá cancelar las cuotas de dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has been living in her own house for the past 21 years. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are 18 and 19 years old. She has a large family, and her son-in-law and 1-year-old grandson also live with her. She is a woman who makes an effort to move forward. For the past 2 years, she has made a living as a cook at a beach restaurant. In addition, her family members also provide support to cover household expenses.

Maria is a visionary woman who always looks for the best for her family. For this reason, she has decided to build a restroom in her house. Since she does not have the necessary economic stability, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and metal sheets to build a restroom in her house, knowing that if she relies on her work she will be able to repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and metal sheets to build a restroom in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cacao seedlings

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is a new cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Red Bank, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He is eager to join the cacao industry because he sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. Pablo believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop that is both good for the environment and will help develop his local community. 

As the father of four children, Pablo wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan so he can expand his cacao farm by purchasing 500 trees ready to be transplanted. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase 500 cacao trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the graduation expenses for her two daughters.

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta de 53 años de edad es una mujer que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos de los que viven con ella 2 una mujer de 20 años y un varón de 26, además vive con ellos su yerno y dos nietos de uno de 3 y otro de 10 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida desde hace mucho tiempo elaborando y vendiendo tortillas, además hace algunos años decidió instalar una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda. Marta sabe que las condiciones en las que se encuentra su vivienda no son buenas, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos, cemento y arena para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta is 53 is a woman who has managed to help her children get ahead. Two live with her, one a woman of 20 and a man of 26, as well as her son-in-law and two grandchildren, one aged 3 and another aged 10. She has made a living for a long time making and selling tortillas. Several years ago, she also decided to set up a small shop selling basic produce from her home.

Marta knows that the conditions of her house are not good, so she has decided to ask for a loan through FUSAI. She will use this to invest in roofing material, wood, nails, cement and sand to change the roof and to cement the floor of the corridor in her house.

loans.use: to invest in roofing material, wood, nails, cement and sand to change the roof and to cement the floor of the corridor in her house.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Umaru. He is married and has 5 children aged 21,17,15,11 and 8. In 2012, Umaru established his provision shop business. He began his business to develop himself and to support his family. 

Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 924,900 every month from this business. He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Umaru requires a loan in order to add to his business capital and to improve the profit by buying more cartons of sugar, milk, ovomaltine, mayonnaise etc.  

In the future, Umaru plans to expand his business to larger scale to build a house for his children and to educate them. He is hard working. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of milk, ovomaltine, mayonnaise, bags of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Chernor. He is married, and has 3 children aged 17, 5 and 3.  In 2012, Chernor established his food stuff (rice, vegetable oil Maggie and onions) business. He began his business with the hope of getting a permanent source of income to provide livelihood and other support to his family.   

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,653,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 5,000,000. Chernor requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, onions, gallons of vegetable oil etc for his shop. 

In the future, Chernor plans to develop agricultural production (food production and animal rearing), to build a house for his family and to educate his children to a higher level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, onions and gallons of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil and bags of garrie.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional used clothes

loans.name: Monjama

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Monjama. She is married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 5. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her for schooling.  

In 2000, Monjama established her ladies dress and bags business. She began her business with the hope of getting addition income to assist her husband and to develop her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,057,400 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 4,000,000. Monjama requires a loan in order to buy more dresses and ladies bags for her shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately 400,000 SLL. 

In the future, Monjama plans to expand her business to another area and to assist the husband in the running of the home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bails of ladies dress and bags.

loans.name: Tseetuya

texts.en:
Mr. Tseetuya, 63 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has retired from work and gets a state pension. He used to work as an electrician at a power plant. His wife is a clerk at the national supreme court. His son works at a furniture-making company. 

Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house and his family is now living in a comfortable and warm place. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,700,000 MNT to buy an automobile for his son. His son will use the car for transportation between home and work. Also his son can render taxi services to local people during his day off for extra income.

loans.use: to buy an automobile.

loans.name: Nueva Florecita Group

texts.en:
Los Encuentros is a bustling town in rural Chichicastenango, Guatemala. Here many roads intersect, making it a transportation hub in the middle of quiet rolling fields of corn stalks. In this town, eleven businesswomen have come together to form the Trust Bank “Nueva Florecita,” or “New Little Flower.” All of the members of the group make and sell guipiles, beautiful, colorful blouses work by the majority of Mayan women in Guatemala. 

María is the secretary of the Trust Bank. Although she is the youngest member at only 24 years of age, she was chosen by the group to fill this important position due to her exemplary oral and written Spanish skills and her six years of education. She is married with two sons. María’s husband sells cellphone parts and accessories. Together they work very hard to provide an education and a nutritious lifestyle for their children. With the new loan, María plans to hire an additional employee to increase her supply of textiles to meet the demand as well as purchase various types of thread. 

The ladies of the “Nueva Florecita” Trust Bank truly appreciate the opportunities that have opened up to them through the loans and education Friendship Bridge provides. Their participation in training on health and nutrition, business administration and self-esteem has helped them make informed decisions that affect their futures, and the future of their families. 

The women of the Trust Bank are grateful to Kiva investors around the globe for their generosity in helping the members move ahead in their businesses and lives. As empowered women, they are excited to create better lives for themselves and their families as well as their community of Los Encuentros.

loans.use: to purchase various types of thread.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad es una mujer casada que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 16 años al lado de su esposo, sus 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 5 años de edad y su madre una mujer de 70 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, además su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar con su trabajo como mecánico de obra de banco. La vivienda de María cuenta con un corredor que es utilizado para el lavadero y la pila, por lo que ella desea mejorarlo cambiando el techo y colocando ladrillo de piso, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena para cambiar el techo y colocar ladrillo de piso en el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria, 36 years old, is a married woman who has lived in her own home for 16 years with her husband, 3 children of 14, 11 and 5 years of age and her mother, a 70 year old woman. 

She is a woman who always searches for a way to move her family forward, for which she provides in-home domestic services. Additionally, her husband helps her with the household costs with his work as a mechanic in a machine shop.

Maria’s home has a hallway that is used for the washing stone and the water trough. She wants to improve this by changing the roof and laying tile. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sheet metal, planks, floor tiles, cement and sand to change the roof and to lay tile in the hallway of her home.

loans.use: to invest in: sheet metal, planks, floor tiles, cement and sand to change the roof and to lay tile in the hallway of her home.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El  Sr. Luciano es casado y con hijos. Tiene una despensa-carnicería en su casa, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio y con la ayuda de su esposa pudo montar. Cuenta además con un camión que hace reparto de frutas y verduras en el mercado.
El y su familia son muy queridos en el barrio por ser personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Luciano pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa y seguir así con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sr. Luciano is married and has children. He has a food pantry and butcher shop in his home. With great effort and sacrifice, Luciano and his wife were able to establish theses businesses. He also has a truck that he uses to deliver fruits and vegetables to and from the market.

Luciano and his family are greatly admired in their neighborhood for being hardworking and enterprising people. He is requesting this loan in order to buy various products for his food pantry. As a result, he can continue his sales.

loans.use: to buy various products for his food pantry.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. Analyn is married and has a business buying and selling crabs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of crabs to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for 6 years now,.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of crabs to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Maria is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell fin her vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old hard worker Edmond, who is married and has a little child. He lives in a suburb of a town in the southeast of the country and along the national road, Tirana-Korca. He’s been photographed inside his poorly kept home. 

Edmond wants to start up a buying/reselling activity of used items, and this is why he needs your help. He is promising that he will pay back the loan in full. 
Edmond owns some agricultural land where he plants mostly cucumbers, beans, potatoes and tomatoes. He then sells such fresh produce to the market of a town located near his village. His wife works in clothing manufacturing.

loans.use: to start a buying/selling activity of used items

loans.name: Khannorjin

texts.en:
Mrs. Khannorjin used her previous loan to buy a sewing machine in order to increase output. 

Her business is growing and she is in need of employees. So she is requesting  a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy one more sewing machine for her new employee.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: María de 51 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante al hijo que ha procreado junto a su esposo con el cual habita en vivienda propia desde hace 11 años. Ella es una mujer muy inteligente que siempre ha procura que su familia tenga lo mejor que esta en sus manos, ademas su esposo es un hombre responsable que siempre la ha apoyado gracias a su trabajo en el mercado central. María sabe que en su vivienda las necesidades son muchas, pero la principal para ella es construir un  muro de contención en su vivienda, ya que esta colinda con una parte de su terreno tiene una parte con caída como se observa en la fotografía, y es para eso que María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, hierro, cemento y arena para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda y evitar así que lo disparejo del terreno pueda dañar a la misma.
texts.en:
Maria, age 51, is a hardworking woman who makes a living offering her services as a domestic worker. It's thanks to this work that she has succeeded in providing for her son, along with her husband, and living in their own house for eleven years.  She is a very intelligent woman who always seeks whatever is needed to ensure that her family has the best of what is available in hand. Her husband is also a responsible man who has always supported her thanks to his work at the central market. 

Maria is well aware of the many needs facing her household, but the principal need for her is the construction of a retaining wall, as it abuts a part of a hillside that has partially collapsed, as can be seen in the photograph. It is for this project that Maria is taking out a loan with FUSAI to invest in bricks, rebar, cement, and gravel to build the retaining wall and prevent the hillside from settling unevenly and damaging her house.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, rebar, cement, and gravel to build a retaining wall for her house.

loans.name: Josue Cupertino

texts.es: Josué de 29 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y el hijo que han procreado de 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día por llevar el sustento a su hogar prestando sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana. Para Josué lo más importante es su familia y la comodidad de ellos, por lo que siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y es por ello que desea realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomacorriente, caja térmica, alambres, etc. Para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Josué, age 29, is a hardworking man who lives in his own house along with his partner and their 4-year-old son. He is a man who makes the daily effort to provide for his home, working as a security guard at a nearby business. For Josué the most important thing is his family and their comfort; he is always looking for ways to improve their living conditions. This is why he hopes to succeed in providing electricity for his house, and why he is taking out a loan with FUSAI, with which he will invest in the electrical sockets, fuse box, wires, etc. needed to install an electrical connection for his house.

loans.use: to invest in electrical sockets, a fuse box, wires, etc in order to connect his house with electricity.

loans.name: Richa

texts.en:
Richa is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Richa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Richa has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella works hard to support her family. Rodella is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rodella requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rodella has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Rodella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, threads, etc for her tailoring business.

Ederlinda earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, threads.

loans.name: Razelda

texts.en:
Razelda works hard to support her family. Razelda is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

Razelda requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Razelda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Razelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara works hard to support her family. Sahara is married and has a buying and selling of clothing business in the Philippines.

Sahara requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Sahara has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Sahara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambasuren, 43 years old, lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store since 2004. Her husband works as a heavy truck driver at a mining company. Their son lives on his own in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy foodstuffs in a large amount. As a result, she can continue to run her grocery store without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in a large amount

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Tuvshinbayar, 28 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2004. His wife stays at home, taking care of house chores. Their elder child goes to elementary school, while the younger one stays at kindergarten. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy spare parts in order to repair his truck before winter.

loans.use: to repair his truck before winter

loans.name: Nereyda Rocio

texts.es: Nereyda de 25 años de edad es una mujer que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante apoyada en su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad con los que habita en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer que se gana la vida atendiendo a los clientes de un negocio de venta de carne desde hace 4 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena experiencia en los negocios. Nereyda siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para repellar las paredes y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nereyda is 25 years old. She is a woman who always does her best to succeed in life, with the help of her life companion and her eight-year-old son, with whom she has been living in their own home for a long time. 

She has been earning a living serving customers in a meat store for four years so she has  good business experience. 

Nereyda is always looking for a way of improving her family's living conditions, and that is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can purchase cement, sand, and gravel in order to plaster the walls and install a cement floor in her home.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and gravel to plaster the walls and install a cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Gamaniel Alberto

texts.es:
Gamaniel Alberto tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar, natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano,maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Dicha comunidad stá ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Gamaniel Alberto es a la decoración y ambientación de eventos sociales con diseño de figuras en ternopol. Gamaniel Alberto es conocido en la zona como uno de los mejores decoradores, ya que cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio. El destino del crédito será para la compra de telas y ternopol para poder atender todos los pedidos que tiene para las fiestas de chocolatadas que se aproximan por capaña navideña. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gamaniel Alberto is 41 years old, single, and lives in the family home. He is a native of the area. Life in his district is peaceful. The residents engage in agriculture and livestock breeding as their main source of income. They also plant and harvest bananas, corn, black-eyed peas, and other crops. This community is located in the District and Province of Morropón, which is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Gamaniel Alberto’s business involves providing decoration services for social events, as well as designing figures made out of styrofoam. He is known in the area for being one of the best decorators since he has more than five years of experience in this business. His loan will be used to buy fabrics and styrofoam so that he can provide his services for all of the hot chocolate parties that will be taking place during the upcoming Christmas season. In the short term, Gamaniel Alberto will be able to increase his earnings, improve his income, and eventually improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and styrofoam for his decoration business.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
This is Merlina, 57, a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Alexander, a retired police personnel, and she is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merlina mainly offers motor parts and accessories. She handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion of their business. They have a vast selection of motorcycle parts from mufflers, windshields, exhaust, wheels, tires, tubes and many others. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of motor parts needed to increase her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Merlina hopes to have another shop in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of motorcycle parts and accessories.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 49 years old, married and has seven children, three of whom are in school.  

Teodora is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Teodora requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teodora has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Susan has been in this business for 6 years. Susan earns more income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. Anita is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Anita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Anita has been in this business for 2 years now.

Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling abacca fiber. Nenita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell in her dry goods business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Apple

texts.en:
Apple is 27 years old and married with one child.

Apple works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Apple has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from vending food and vegetables.

Apple aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 56 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Aurora works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, chocolate drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, juice, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell.

Aurora has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, chocolate drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, juice, cereals, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Aurora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, chocolate drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, juice, cereals, noodles, to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has five children who are in school. Avelina has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

Avelina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 46 years old and married with two children. Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, etc. 

Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 57 years old and widowed with seven children. With three children still in school, Esterlita works very hard to provide for them.

Esterlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Esterlita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, cooking oil, bread, juice, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón está casado con la Sra. Sonia hace 2 años aun no tienen hijos, pero en un futuro no muy lejano quieren tenerlos.
Ramón tiene un negocio en donde vende todo tipo de bebidas. El se inicio en esta actividad con un pequeño capital que juntaron la pareja cuando aún eran solteros. Gracias al trabajo emprendido tiene una casa cómoda y con todas las necesidades del hogar. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias para poder seguir con su venta como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón has been married to Sra. Sonia for two years. Even though they have no children, they hope to have some in the near future.

Ramón has a business where he sells all types of beverages. He started this business with a small amount of capital that he and his wife had saved up when they were single. Thanks to his hard work, he now has a comfortable home with all of the household necessities.

Ramón is requesting this loan in order to buy various beverages. As a result, he will be able to continue his sales as before.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora de 50 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, ya que hace mucho tiempo instalo una pequeña tienda. Ella es madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que ha logrado sacar adelante a base de mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, y habita junto a ellos en vivienda propia desde hace 50 años ya que es una herencia de sus padres. Teodora siempre está buscando la manera de dar lo mejor a su familia y por ello que desea construir un corredor y realizar la conexión de energía eléctrica en su vivienda, para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, laminas, arena, cemento, alambre, tomacorriente, etc. Para construir el corredor e instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Teodora, age 50, is a hardworking woman who earns a living selling various daily needs items from her house, where she has operated a small store for many years. She is a single mother of three children, who she has succeeded in providing for through much sacrifice and effort. She lives with them in her house, where she has lived her entire life, as it was an inheritance from her parents. Teodora is always looking out for ways to give her family the best, which is why she wants to build a hallway and install an electrical connection for her house. For this, she is taking out a loan with FUSAI to buy posts, sheet metal, gravel, cement, wire, electrical sockets, etc.

loans.use: to buy posts, sheet metal, gravel, cement, wire, electrical sockets, etc. to build a hallway and install an electrical connection for her house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old from Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married and blessed with five children. Her husband earns a living from farming wherein they only get an income at harvest season. 

It is hard for them to make ends meet, that’s why they want to avail themselves of a PHP 150,000 loan from the Kiva lenders which they will use to pay for the tuition fees of their daughter, Raña. She is taking up BS in Secondary Education. She wants to finish her studies to find a stable job and be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Carmen Guadalupe

texts.es: Carmen de 40 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo artículos de primera necesidad en una tienda que instalo en su vivienda hace más de 7 años. Ella es una mujer responsable que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo con el que ha procreado 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad. Carmen tiene el piso de su corredor deteriorado, por lo que ella desea encementarlo, además desea cambiar el techo del mismo, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y pines para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Carmen, age 40, is a hardworking woman who makes a living selling daily needs items from a store she set up in her house over seven years ago. She is a responsible woman who lives in her own house along with her husband and their two children, ages 11 and six. The floor in Carmen's house is deteriorating, so she wants to pave it. She also hopes to replace the roof. This is why she is seeking a loan with FUSAI, so she can buy cement, gravel, sheet metal, and nails to complete the work.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sheet metal, and nails to replace the roof and pave the floor of her house.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en: Faustino is a 51-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is a farmer who plants and harvest rice and vegetables for sale. Aside from this, he  also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He aspires to uplift the living status of his family in order to give his two children a better life. In this regard, he would like to strengthen his hog-raising business to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, he would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to15,000 PHP to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. Having this financial assistance, he believes that he will further improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Celestino Ferdinand

texts.en:
Celestino Ferdinand is 49 years old and is from Luna, Isabela. He is married and blessed with four children. With the little income they get from farming, he finds it difficult to send his son to college. 

His son Celestino III is taking up a BS in Radiology Technology. He wants to study and graduate to be successful and be able to help his parents who worked hard to provide for their needs. He chose this course because this is in demand inside and outside the country. 

Studying is difficult and what makes it more difficult is having financial difficulties. So to help him, Celestino wants to avail himself of a PHP 150,000 education loan from the Kiva lenders. He is hopeful that lenders will approve his loan so his son can continue pursuing his college degree.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Esterlita is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Esterlita has a general store business in the Philippines. Esterlita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Esterlita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 48 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Delma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Delma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Delma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional amounts of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers in her electronic mobile load retailing business.

Emerlita has been in this business for 9 years. Emerlita earns additional income from a printing service.

Emerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional amounts of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Erra Grace

texts.en:
Erra Grace is 23 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erra Grace has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Erra Grace requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Erra Grace has been in this business for 3 years. Erra Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn works hard to support her family. Genalyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Genalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Genalyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 28 años ala lado de sus hijos, por lo que se siente my feliz de poder contar con este beneficio aunque su vivienda sea humilde sabe que lo más importante es tener un lugar donde vivir. Ella lucha desde muy joven para poder sacar adelante a su familia y es por ello que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace muchos años. Evangelina siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de construir una galera en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines, cemento, arena y grava para construir una galera en su vivienda.
texts.en: Evangelina, age 48, is a hardworking woman who has lived in her own house for 28 years along with her children. She feels very grateful to be able to provide a home to her children, even though it is a humble house. She knows that the most important thing is have a place to live. She has fought from a very young age to make a better life for her family, which is why she has made a living as a domestic worker for many years. Evangelina is always looking for ways to improve her living conditions, which is why she has decided to add a kitchen to her house. For this she is seeking a loan with FUSAI, in order to buy sheet metal, posts, nails, cement, and gravel to complete the work.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, posts, nails, cement, and gravel so she can add a kitchen to her house.

loans.name: Jose Osmin

texts.es: José de 49 años de edad es un hombre que desde muy joven se gana la vida como agricultor y albañil, ya que cuando no tiene trabajo como albañil busca de jornalero, por lo que es reconocido en su cantón como un hombre trabajador, y es gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación que ha logrado construir su vivienda, en el terreno que habita desde que nació. Él habita junto a sus padres y sus hermanos por lo que su mayor responsabilidad son sus padres que depende de el económicamente, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecho de poder retribuir un poco de lo mucho que sus padres le han dado. José logro construir su vivienda, pero no pudo instalar la energía eléctrica por falta de liquidez económica, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pago de derecho de instalación y alambre, caja térmica, interruptores y tomacorriente para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose is a 49 years old man who, since he was very young, has earned his own way as a farmer and cement mason. When he could not find work as a mason, he looked for work as a day laborer. For that reason, he is well known as a hard worker. And it is thanks to his efforts and dedication that he has managed to construct his own house on land he has occupied since his birth. Jose lives there with his parents and brothers. Jose's major responsibility is his parents who depend on him economically. 

For that reason, Jose feels very happy and satisfied to be able to return a bit of what his parents have given him. He managed to construct his own house but he could not install electrical energy for lack of funds. Consequently, he decided to request a loan through FUSAI to invest in paying for an installation permit, wiring, a control  panel, switches, and electrical outlets to install electricity in his house.

loans.use: to pay for an installation permit, wire, an electricity control panel, switches, and electrical outlets to install electric energy in his house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Ilagan City, Isabela. She is married with two children. Her husband works as a laborer while she operates their sari sari store. Though both of them are earning, it is sometimes not enough for all their expenses especially since they are sending their son, Cliford Jay to college. 

That’s why they want to seek a PHP 150,000 financial assistance loan from the Kiva lenders. Cliford is taking up a BS in Secondary Education. He wants to finish college to improve his family’s way of living.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie from Cauayan City, Isabela is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer while she manages their sari sari store. With their little earnings, it is difficult for them to send their son Rolando to college. Consequently Margie is requesting a 200,000 PHP education loan to pay for Rolando’s tuition fee. Rolando is taking a B.S. in Secondary Education. He wants to earn a professional degree and educate students in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Zuleyma De Jesus

texts.es: Zuleyma de 38 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita junto a sus 3 hijos de 12, 18 y 9 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 13 años. Ella es una que a pesar de la pérdida de su esposo no se ha dejado vencer y ha puesto todo de su parte para sacar adelante a sus hijos sabiendo que la responsabilidad es mayor para ella por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de comida de forma ambulante en el mercado central, además para tener mejores ingresos elabora y vende tamales los fines de semana para lograr así darles lo mejor a sus hijos. Zuleyma siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y hace un tiempo ha observado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Zuleyma of 38 years of age is a hard working woman who has lived with her 3 children 12, 18 and 9 years old in her own home for the last 13 years.

Despite the loss of her husband, she has not given up, and has done everything in her power to raise her children,  knowing that the responsibility is greater for her.  She decided to sell mobile food in the central market.  In addition, to increase her earnings, she makes and sells tamales on the weekends to provide the best for her children.

 Zuleyma is always looking for ways to improve their living conditions and lately she has noticed that the roof of  their house is damaged, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in:   galvanized sheet, poles and pins to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized sheet, poles and pins to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Lobres

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lobres works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lobres is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Lobres has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Basilia has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Basilia has been in this business for six years now. In the future, Basilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Bernarda Ines

texts.es: Bernarda de 34 años de edad es una mujer que sale a ganarse la vida desde muy temprano prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace 6 años. Ella habita junto a su compañero de vida y su 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 4 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar son su vivienda. Bernarda tiene el deseo de construir una cocina aparte de su vivienda, para tener más espacio tanto en su vivienda como en la cocina ya que la vivienda es bastante pequeña por lo que ella desea corregir el hacinamiento en el que viven, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, hierro y lámina para construir una cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en: 34-year-old Bernarda is a woman that leaves her house very early in the morning to make a living. She has worked as a housekeeper for 6 years. She lives in her own home with her life partner and their 3 children ages 13, 11 and 4. She is very happy to have owned her home for 15 years. Bernarda wishes to build a kitchen as an annex to her home, in order to have more space, as the home is very small. She wishes for her family not to be overcrowded and is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron and sheets to build a new kitchen in her home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron and sheets to build a new kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 44-year-old, mother who has two school age children. She is engaged in buying and selling dry goods within the public market to help her husband to gain income. She has been in this business for almost seven years. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to further improve her business to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more stock of pants, t-shirts, blouses, polo shirts, short pants, jackets and underwear to sell. Through this financial assistance, Magdalena believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of pants, t-shirts, blouses, polo shirts, short pants, jackets and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
This is Carina, 36, a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Franklin, her business partner, and she has children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carina operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish pan de sal, or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students, and workers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy raw supplies such as flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carina dreams to have a bigger bakery and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs in her bakery.

loans.name: Kheyneth

texts.en:
Kheyneth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Kheyneth is 28 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Kheyneth has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business. She has been in this business for five years. Kheyneth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Christine Joy

texts.en:
Christine Joy is a BS accounting student from Roxas, Isabela. She is also a dreamer. She dreams not only for herself but for her family as well. She wants to finish college to secure her future and to have education as her means of achieving her goals. 

Christine Joy also dreams of being financially stable and she believes that her chosen course will help her achieve this goal. To help her support her studies, Christine is requesting an education loan of 150,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 52 años de edad es una mujer que sabe ganarse la vida apoyada en su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con ese apoyo. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde que nació ya que su vivienda es una herencia familiar, en la que vive junto a su grupo familiar. Ana tiene el deseo de encementar el piso del corredor, ya que como se observa en la fotografía el piso de este es de tierra lo que causa suciedad cuando llueve por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 52 years old, is a woman who knows how to make a living supported by her business of selling staples in her house.  She feels very happy to be able to count on that support.  She has lived in this house since birth as this is a family inheritance.  She lives here with her family.
