Ana wishes to cement the floor of the corridor.  As you can see in the picture, this floor is made of dirt which causes a mess when it rain.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the corridor of her house.

loans.use: To invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El Sr. Americo está casado con la Sra. Elva  hace varios años, tienen 3 hijos que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo han podido criar.
Él Trabaja como Transportista, además de ese trabajo la Sra. Elva trabaja vendiendo productos varios de primera necesidad traídas de la argentina.    
 Gracias al trabajo que están realizando,  educan a su hijo y compran las comodidades del hogar. -
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de chapería y pintura de su camión que usa para los transportes que hace, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Americo has been married to Sra. Elva for several years. They have three children who they have been raising with great effort and sacrifice.

Americo works in the transportation business. In addition to his job, Sra. Elva works by selling various basic household products that she brings back from Argentina.

Thanks to their work, Americo and his wife have been able to educate their children and purchase goods to make their home comfortable. He is requesting this loan in order to cover the cost of paint and body work for the truck that he uses for making his trips. This will be of great help.

loans.use: to cover the cost of paint and body work for his truck.

loans.name: Bardhyl

texts.en:
Bardhyl is an Egyptian Albanian who is applying for this loan to purchase a furnace for the dental laboratory that his two sons (25 and 20) own; particularly, they make dentures. They live in the city of Korca with a decent population and most are elders, with the young ones immigrating to other countries. This fact increases the demand for such services, according to Bardhyl and his sons, also who were interviewed simultaneously.  Bardhyl lives with them both and his wife who recently had a surgery to remove a large tumor from inside her skull. 

Bardhyl wants to thank lenders in advance for their potential financial help. This will be his ninth loan from VFA.   Kindly note that standing up in the photograph is Bardhyl, and the other person is Vesildo, his 25-year-old son.

loans.use: to purchase a furnace for the dental laboratory that his sons own; they make dentures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medicines.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es: Verónica de 35 años de edad es una mujer que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para recorrer las calles del municipio realizando la venta de café y pan dulce, ya que desde hace algunos años esta ha sido la forma que encontró para ganarse la vida y  tratar de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecho de poder contar con este pequeño negocio. Ella es una mujer casada que vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años de edad. Verónica ha observado que desde hace algún tiempo el techo de su vivienda ha estado presentando filtraciones por lo que desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Verónica is 35 and is married. She lives with her husband and their three children aged 15, 11 and 6. She is a woman who gets up early every day to go and sell coffee and sweet bread in the streets of her town. For several years, this has been the way she found of earning a living and trying to improve living conditions for her family. She therefore feels happy and satisfied to be able to have this small business.

Verónica has noticed for a while that the roof of her house has been leaking, which is why she wants to change its roof. Therefore, she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in galvanised sheeting and fasteners for changing the roof.

loans.use: to invest in galvanised sheeting and fasteners to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es: La señora es habitante de la ciudad de chinandega es madre de tres hijos es trabajadora de la alcaldia como operaria de limpieza es trabajadora , responsable y tiene muchos sueños de superacion para sus hijos ella solicita el financiamiento para terminar pagos de etudios de sus hijos para gastos medicos de ella
texts.en: The woman is a resident of the city of Chinandega. She is a mother of three children, works for the city as a cleaner, is hard-working, responsible, and has many dreams of improvements for her children. She is asking for a loan to finish paying her children's educational costs and for her medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora es habitante de la ciudad de chinandega es madre soltera  tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta a su cargo  en edad escolar es trabajadora de la alcaldia en el area de limpieza publica es una mujer trabajadora con deseo de superacion ella es una persona sencilla y responsable
texts.en: The woman is a resident of the city of Chinandega. She is a single mother who has 2 children, of whom one is school-aged and in her care. She works for the city as a public cleaner. She is a hard-working woman with desires of improving herself. She is a simple and responsible person.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila de 53 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que desde muy temprano se levanta y sale a comprar la mercadería que venderá en el mercado central del departamento, ya que sabe que esta es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo que pone todo su empeño y amabilidad para tener buenos ingresos de su venta de verduras la cual realiza desde hace 23 años. Ella es madre de 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 14 años de edad además vive con ellos un nieto de 4 años de edad y es gracias a su esfuerzo que ha logrado sacarlos adelante como madre soltera. Lucila desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este ha presentado algunas filtraciones, ocasionando que sus pocas pertenencias se mojen y deterioren por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Lucila is a hard-working, 53-year-old woman, who gets up early every day to buy the goods that she sells at the local market. As this is her only source of income, she puts all her effort into getting good results and being amicable so that she can earn a good income from her vegetable sales, a job that she has been doing for the last 23 years. She has three children, who are 22, 20 and 14, and a four-year-old grandson, who also lives with them. It is thanks to her hard work that she has been able to give her children a good start in life, as she is a single mother. Lucila would like to replace the roof of her home, because the one she has right now leaks and the few possessions she has have gotten wet. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, beams, and fasteners to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wooden beams and fasteners to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 58 years old and married with two children, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

Adoracion has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soap powder, vinegar, vegetable, etc.  In the future, Adoracion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 14-cubic-foot fridge and a fan.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 35 años de edad es una mujer que se gana la vida desde hace 4 años prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar en unas colonias cercanas. Ella es una mujer reconocida en su cantón por su responsabilidad y honestidad ya que desde hace 35 años habita en casa propia actualmente junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad. Marta siempre ha desea mejorar su vivienda, principalmente el piso que es de tierra, y en épocas de lluvia este se convierte en lodo provocando insalubridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marta is a 35-year-old woman who has earned a living for the past four years working a a domestic cleaner in houses close to her home. She is well-known in her town for her responsibility and honesty and has lived in the same house all of her life, which she now shares with her partner and their two children, who are 14 and 16 years old.  Marta has always wanted to improve her home, especially the dirt floor, which in rainy season turns into mud and is not good for their health. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand and gravel in order to put down a cement floor for her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand and gravel to give her home a solid floor.

loans.name: Diana Lucia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa Ana.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años de edad, el cual estudia en escuela, ella vive en la casa de los padres.
Doña Diana es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida y lucha para que a su hijo nunca le falte nada. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Leva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a su hijo.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, which is known for its beautiful landscapes and lovely waterfront resorts that are frequented by many tourists, the members of the Communal Bank “Santa Ana” meet every 15 days.

Sra. Diana lives in this place. She is 52 years old and a single mother of an eight-year-old child who is in school. They live at her parents’ house.

Doña Diana is a determined woman who enjoys doing something worthwhile in order to get ahead. She sells clothes of all types by going door-to-door. Diana also sells out of her house since customers come to her whenever they need a particular item. She extends credit to her customers and collects payment every week. Diana has been in this business for more than two years in order to make a living. She strives to make sure that her child lacks nothing.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and other garments. She has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to finance her business. Her dreams include providing the best for her child.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle, 58, is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell dry goods store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more dry goods to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida desde hace más de 30 años como jornalero de una finca cercana a su domicilio, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con su trabajo. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 1 años de edad desde hace 6 años lo que le hace sentirse feliz y orgulloso de tener un lugar propio donde vivir. José siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: José is 47-year-old, hard-working man, who has made a living for the past 30 years as a day laborer at a farm close to where he lives. He feels happy that he has a job. He lives in his own home with his life partner and their two children, aged 17 and 1. He is very happy and proud to have owned his home for the past six years. José is always looking for ways to improve his family's and his own quality of life, and that is why he decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, wood and nails to replace the roof of his house, which has worn out.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood and nails to replace the roof of his home, which has worn out.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 50-year-old married mother of five. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For the past year Avelina has been operating a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as soap, eggs, oil, onions, etc. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as cigarettes, beverages, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as cigarettes, beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita, a 58-year-old married mother of three children, works very hard to provide for them. For the past year she has operated a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sandwich spreads, noodles, eggs, etc. 

Edita has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, 47, is married with five children. Two of her children are in school, and Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She sells a variety of items, such as beverages, biscuits, snack foods and toothpaste. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy shampoo, groceries and other items to sell.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries and other items to sell.

loans.name: Salvadora De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Salvadora de Jesús Z. es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña en el área de limpieza pública tiene de trabajar cinco años y su financiamiento lo solicito para hacerle una mejora a su casa la señora va a poner el piso de su casa para tener un mejor nivel de vida ella poco a poco ha hido mejorando su casa con los financiamientos otorgados.
texts.en: Salvadora de Jesús Z has been working for the Chinandega municipal government as a street cleaner, for five years.  She applied for her loan in order to make improvements to her home so she can have a better standard of living. Little by little she has been improving her home with the loans she has been granted.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal roofing for her home.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 55, is married with six children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Linda runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy shampoo, groceries and other items to sell.  

In the future, Linda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights and groceries for her store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Nenita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman and has been blessed with seven children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 8 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
Muhamadi is 35 years and lives in Masindi-Uganda. He has 4 children and they all attend school.

Muhamadi provides ploughing services by using his tractor.  He also does farming business in order to support his family. 

He faces a hardship of few customers and expensive spare parts for his tractor. He intends to use the loan to buy spare partsand repair his tractor.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his tractor.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a responsible housewife who was engages in buying and selling dry goods within the public market. She is 40 years old and blessed with four children. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income to meet the necessities of her family. For this reason, she needs to further improve the business to increase her income. 

Having inadequate capital, she wants to access additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy more stock of jackets, t-shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, underwear, foot sacks and polo shirts to sell. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jackets, t-shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, underwear, foot sacks and polo shirts to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 54 years old from Iguig, Cagayan. She is married and blessed with four children. They earn through farming, which is sometimes hard for them because they only get their earnings after harvest. That’s why to help send their daughter Millet to college, Lolita wants to avail PHP 200,000 education loan from the Kiva lenders. Millet is taking up a BS Civil Engineering. She is eager to finish college, for she believes that education is the greatest thing she can rely on in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23 year old, single man, living with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied up to Secondary education level but he couldn't complete his studies. 

Ali spent most of his time as a driver with a water company with a small salary. That salary isn't enough to cover the necessary expenses of his family. 

In order to increase his income, Ali decided to start his own business by purchasing a bus and working as a driver. He will transport people to earn suitable money that will help him improve the living standards of his family. Unfortunately; Ali has a small amount of money that is not enough to purchase a bus. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a bus to work as a driver. 

Ali looks forward to starting a business to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a bus and work as a driver.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has a retail shop in Nakuru town and has been running this business for 4 years now. He is 39 years old, married and together with his spouse has been blessed with 5 children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of maize flour, rice, cooking fat, cooking oil, jelly, bars of soap and washing detergents to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family.

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. In future he hopes to grow his business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Isvela De La Paz

texts.es:
Isvela  de 58 años de edad, es maestra, está divorciada, tiene 2 hijos quienes estudian en la universidad.


Toda su vida la ha se ha dedicado a enseñar a sus alumnos en las aulas de clases, para que sean personas preparadas académicamente. Le gusta esta profesión, ya que siempre le ha gustado servir, y de esta manera contribuye a la educación de muchos alumnos. El lugar de trabajo está a casi 1 kilómetro de su casa. Trabaja de 7 de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.


El crédito será invertido para cancelar los estudios universitarios de sus dos hijos. Ya que lo que más desea que ellos logren superarse y solo estudiando podrán hacerlo.

Isvela es una mujer que le apasiona superarse, es por eso que le gustaría continuar preparándose, esta vez estudiaría una maestría en psicología, además sueña con ver graduada a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Isvela is a 58-year-old teacher, divorced, and the mother of two children who attend university. 

Isvela has spent her entire career teaching children in classrooms in order for them to be academically qualified. She enjoys teaching, as she's always found it rewarding to serve others and contribute to the education of so many students. The school where she works is nearly a kilometer from her home, and she works from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  

Isvela will use this loan to pay for her children's university studies. Her greatest hope is that they'll improve their lives, and studying is the only way to achieve that goal. 

Isvela is passionate about improving her life, and would like to continue her own education by pursuing a masters degree in Psychology. She also hopes to see her children become university graduates.

loans.use: to pay for her two children's university studies.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 43 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as fabric conditioner, soap, biscuits, coffee, candies etc.  In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en: Evelinda is 44 years old and has five children, and two of her children are in school. Evelinda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like, canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, biscuits, candies and etc. In the future, Evelinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like, canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. Aida is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear.

Aida has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Aida would like to have money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear.

loans.name: Noryn

texts.en:
Noryn is 34 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Noryn works very hard to provide for them.

Noryn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, beer, etc. to sell.

Noryn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, beer, etc. 

Noryn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, beer, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 47 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Herminia works very hard to provide for them.

Herminia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, cigarettes, soap, etc. to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as threads, eggs, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, cigarettes, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Floredith

texts.en: Floredith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, etc. Floredith has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Floredith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna, 48, is married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.

Luna has requested a loan of 26,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more materials, like shells, nylon thread, etc., for her business.

In the future, Luna would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials, like shells, nylon thread, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is 40 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for their daily needs. Margarita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as sugar, salt, biscuits, soap etc.  In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has three children who are in school. Remedios has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock like slippers, books, etc. to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for six years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like slippers, books, etc.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana de 33 años de edad es ama de casa, estudió hasta quinto grado, aunque sus aspiraciones eran ser una gran profesionalel bajo nivel económico se lo impidió, ahora está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos, el mayor se dedica ayudar a los quehaceres del hogar y en los trabajos agrícolas, los 2 menores estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. 


Ana se dedica a vender productos por catalogo,ella se desplaza casa por casa en la comunidad para que las persones le encarguen los productos que desean y al mes siguiente reparte la mercadería encargada a sus clientes, los productos que mas se venden son lociones, desodorantes, cosméticos para damas etc, tiene 5 años de vender estos productos aproximadamente, en lo tiempos libres se dedica a ayudar a su pareja en la agricultura.

El crédito sera utilizado para preparar la tierra y a la vez para la compra de insumos agricolas tales como abono, semilla, veneno, sulfato y también para pagarle a los muchachos que le ayudaran a la siembra.

El sueño para el futuro es obtener buenos resultados en su cosecha, para obtener mejores ganancias y satisfacer las necesidades básicas que van surgiendo en el hogar, así mismo apoyar a sus hijos económicamente para que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en: Ana is a 33-year-old homemaker. Although she wanted to become a professional, she could only afford to study up to fifth grade. Ana's partner works in farming, and they have three children. Their eldest son helps around the home and on the farm, while the two youngest study at the village school. Ana sells catalog goods door-to-door, delivering the products that her customers order the following month. The products that she sells the most are lotions, deodorant, and makeup. She has been doing this for the past five years, and uses her free time to help her partner with farming work. She will use her loan to pay for the preparation of the land for sowing and to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, seeds, poison, and sulphate, and also to pay the young men who help to sow the seeds. Her dream for the future is to to have a productive harvest so that she make a bigger profit to cover the basic household expenses and to support her children financially so that they can study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, poison, sulphate, and labor costs to prepare the land for sowing.

loans.name: Elmer Ovidio

texts.es:
Elmer de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, ya que le gusto más trabajar con su padre en la agricultura. Está casado su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos y no tienen hijos.

Elmer tiene aproximadamente 15 años de trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su padre, actualmente siembra cultivos de maíz, sandía, melón y pipián, todo esto con ayuda de su esposa. También ha aprendido el trabajo de albañilería, cuando inicio a trabajar como ayudante. También aprendió a criar ganado, pero actualmente no tiene.


El crédito que está solicitando será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto, así tendrá otra fuente de ingresos y no solo dependerá de la agricultura.


El sueño de Elmer es trabajar muy duro, para lograr salir adelante y así mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar su vivienda y además le gustaría tener 2 hijos.
texts.en:
25-year-old Elmer left school after second grade because he preferred doing farming work with his father. He is married. His wife does the domestic chores and they don't have children. 

Elmer has worked in agriculture for approximately 15 years, having learnt the trade from his father. He currently cultivates maize, watermelons, melons and gourds, all with the help of his wife. He also leant the profession of masonry when he started to work as an assistant. He also learnt how to rear cattle, but he does not currently have any. 

The loan that he is asking for will be used to buy pasture cattle. This will mean he will have another source of income and will not depend solely on crop farming.

Elmer's dream is to work hard in order to succeed and improve both his quality of life and his house. He would also like to have two children.

loans.use: to buy pasture cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for household expenses.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use as her part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and mineral water, which she sells retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Jennifer dreams of having a grocery store someday. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is managing her eatery business in Lazi, Siquijor. She mastered the business when she her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Fresca

texts.en: Fresca is 52 years old from Lamo Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She has two children. They have a rolling canteen to support them, but sometimes what they earn is not enough, which makes it hard to send their children to school. To help send their daughter Cheska to college, Fresca wants to seek a PHP 200,000 financial assistance from the Kiva lenders. Cheska is taking up a BS Math and she is really hopeful for this loan to be approved, for she knows that her parents can’t provide all their needs.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

location.town: Lamo Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 56 years old and blessed with two adult-age children. They are currently living in a rural community, earning their living through farming.

Due to the hardships of living, Marietta also engages in a business reselling fruits, vegetables and fish within her village to generate additional income. She wants to continue to strengthen this business to increase her income.

Since she has inadequate capital, she would like a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more stock of string beans, eggplants, onions, squash and tomatoes to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of string beans, eggplants, onions, squash and tomatoes to resell

location.town: Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are still in school. Virginia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old, single and she work very hard to help her parents. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Irene has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients for her business.

Irene has been in this business for three months.  In the future, Irene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of used clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marilyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of used clothes to sell for her used clothes business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 27 years old and married. She was blessed with two children attending school. She helps her husband in gaining income by selling fruits, vegetables and fish within her community. 

She aims to strengthen her business and generate sufficient income, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of an additional 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and fish to resell. Being a patient and diligent mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and fish to resell

location.town: Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 39 years old and has seven children who are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and vegetable seeds.

Mary Jean has been farming vegetables for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming and buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maribel has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell in her food stall.

Maribel has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children. She is 45 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a broom-making business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like straw, bamboo etc. for her broom-making business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy materials like straw and bamboo for her broom-making business

loans.name: Roberto Jr

texts.en:
Roberto Jr is a 31-year-old fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is a married man and has two young children. As a fisherman, Roberto Jr has to work hard to augment his daily catch.
 
As of now, Roberto Jr is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. This loan will help him improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

Roberto Jr believes that his fishing business will soon improve and become sustainable. Moreover, he wants to save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items to help him improve his catch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler pero al menos el y su familia están cómodos Felix es chofer y esta expuesto a los asaltos y al dolor de espalda Felix quiere ayudar a su esposa, por eso necesita un credito para invertir en ropa y juguetes que su esposa piensa vender a fin de año Felix y su esposa gozan de buena salud y harán todo lo posible para obtener utilidades en época navidena
texts.en:
Felix is married, has three children and lives in La Paz in a cement and block house that he rents. And fortunately, his family lives comfortably. He is a driver and is exposed to assaults and serious back pain. 

Felix wants to help his wife, and for this, he needs a loan to invest in clothing and toys that his wife plans to sell at years end. Felix and his wife enjoy good health and will do all that's possible to earn profits at Christmas time.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and toys that his wife wishes to sell at Christmas.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed for her general store. Her store earnings help to cover personal and household needs.

She would now like to apply for a 55,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods and ice crumble which she sells at retail value. Luzviminda knows that having more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source of income for sustaining her family's basic needs and the education of her children. She thanks God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Luzviminda dreams of having a grocery store someday. She aims to give her children the best education possible, in order for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
This is Judith, 51, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Judith offers massage services. She offers whole body massage and also does touch therapy for her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Judith aims to grow her business, and she desires to have a happy and loving family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her massage business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman and has been blessed with six children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Fritzi

texts.en:
Fritzi is married, 62 years old and living in Larena, Siquijor, Philippines.

She joined PMPC in order to access the co-op's programs and services. Recently, she has accessed another loan for additional working capital for her existing business, in order to purchase bulk stock of dry goods and merchandise to sell.

Fritzi wishes to save enough from her business to complete the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase bulk stock of dry goods and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Joevel

texts.en:
Joevel is 44 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

Joevel has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF in the past. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 6 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Leoncia Felipa

texts.es: la señora leoncia  trabaja en la alcaldia desde hace 10 años. se desempeña como operaria de limpieza su labor empieza desde las seis de la mañana  hasta las dos de la tarde, es madre soltera de  cinco hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella, es una mujer muy luchadora, se ha esforzado por llevar el sustento a su hogar y por ir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco, esta solicitando un financiamiento para hacerle el embaldozado a toda su casa para brindarle una mejor condicion de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en: Leoncia has been working in the local government for 10 years. She works as a janitor. Her work starts at 6:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon. She is the single mother of five children, none of whom are economically dependent on her. She is a fighter. She has worked hard to provide for her household and to improve her house bit by bit. She is requesting a loan to stucco her whole house, so she can provide a better quality of life to her whole family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Los Amigos Empresarios Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS AMIGOS EMPRESARIOS” está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Nora tiene 55 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados y ropa a pedido de sus clientes. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sandalias para damas y zapatillas para caballeros y ropa de temporada de verano. En el grupo cumple la función de secretaria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nora es la que se encuentra parada en el lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The "Business People Friends" group is made up of hardworking and responsible women. Nora is 55 years old. She is single with grown children. She sells underwear and clothing by request from her clients. She will use the loan to buy sandals for women and dress shoes for men and clothing for the summer season. In the group, she serves as the secretary. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that has been provided. Nora is the one standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy sandals, dress shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Petrona Mercedes

texts.es: la señora petrona trabaja como operaria de limpieza en la alcaldia desde hace 15 años, es madre soltera tiene a su cargo un hijo el cual estudia y por quien se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante, la señora trabaja arduamente de lunes a domingo en los turnos de seis de la mañana a 12 del medio dia , es una señora que le gusta salir adelante y solicita el financiamiento para  hacerle  una mejora a su vivienda y brindarle mejores condiciones d vida a su nucleo familiar.
texts.en: Petrona has been working as a janitor in the local goverment for 15 years. She is a single mother and has one son in her charge, who is in school, and she works hard to help him get ahead. She works hard from Monday to Sunday, from 6:00 in the morning until 12:00 noon. She likes to get ahead and is requesting a loan to make improvements to her house and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall around her yard: bricks, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Mercurio

texts.en:
This is Mercurio, 53, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Lilibeth, an OFW, and he is blessed with two children. He has been engaged in the Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) retail business for three years now in order to augment the family income to provide for his family's daily needs and the school needs of his children.

Mercurio buys LPG tanks from wholesalers and sell them per tank for a small profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular sized tanks. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, Mercurio is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan which he will use to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given to him. 

Mercurio dreams of his business becoming more profitable and of having his own store. He aims to send his children to school until college and he prays for a happy and quiet life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. There, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Paul Russel

texts.en:
Paul Russel is a strong-willed man who pushes himself when it comes to his piggery business.

He is a hands-on businessman and a father who never tires of supporting his family.

Recently, he received a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from his project of concreting the pig pens, he thought of adding heads of pigs to his inventory for commercial sale. Someday he hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 41, is married with one child, who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year. She sells a variety of products, such as thread, candies, coffee, juice and soap. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy  shampoo, groceries and other items to sell.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries and other items to sell.

loans.name: Resviminda

texts.en:
Resviminda is 34 years old, married, and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling religious articles in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more religious articles to sell.

Resviminda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 10 years and also earns an income from printing t-shirts.

Resviminda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase religious articles to sell

loans.name: Jean Rose

texts.en:
Jean Rose is 18 years old and has 1 child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jean Rose has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 2 years now and she also earns an income selling food.

Jean Rose aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: María  Isabel

texts.es: La señora María es una mujer emprendedora, de profesión Psicóloga Terapeuta, tiene su propia  clínica donde labora y también a domicilio, actividad que le permite mantener su hogar,  tiene un realcion estable donde han procreado un h hijo a quien le brinda el apoyo para su desarrollo,  esta señora visito las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para mejorar las condiciones de su  vivienda y  consultorio, ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la compra  de ceramica, cemento, bondex y  pago de mano de obra lo que vendra a dar mejores condiciones  a  su vivienda y a su trabajo ya que lo realiza en su casa de  habitacion
texts.en: María is an enterprising woman. She works as a therapeutic psychologist. She has her own clinic, which is located in her house. This allows her to take care of her house. She is in a long-term relationship, from which she has one child who she supports. She visited the office of Ceprodel to request a loan to improve the conditions of her house and her clinic. She will use it to buy tiles, cement, and grout, and to pay for labor. This will create better conditions in both her house and her workplace, since she works at home.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, and grout and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo to increase his milk production and supply.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. Sandra works with her husband in their fishing business. This has been the source of their income for the past six years now. 

Sandra wants to expand their fishing venture, but unfortunately she lacks the capital to do so. As of now, she is requesting to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With these fishing materials intact, she and her husband will be able to augment their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Sandra hopes to make their business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
This is Salome, 56, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Alejandro, who makes baskets and charcoal for a living. Together they manage their household while operating their businesses. At this time, Salome is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Salome operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Salome dreams to grow and expand her business. She hopes to make her family always happy and to sustain their everyday needs. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is thankful that she was granted a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos, which she used to purchase merchandise like kids' dresses and clothing for men and women. Her earnings helped cover her family's personal and household expenses and her children's school needs.

She would now like to apply for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy merchandise such as dresses for children and polo shirts for men and women. She is confident that more items in her store will yield more sales, thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and her children's education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that she will receive. 

Ester dreams of expanding her business to give her children the best education to provide a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise, such as kids' dresses, polo shirts for men and women and other personal  products needed in her business.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta tercer grado, es viuda, su esposo murió hace varios años, tiene 2 hijos y los ha tenido que mantener sola por la falta de su esposo, no ha sido fácil para ella, ha tenido que trabajar arduamente en la agricultura, ella siembra maíz y pipían esto lo hace junto a sus hijos.

 María conoce de la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, este trabajo se lo enseño su padre y le ha servido de mucho ya que con esto a podido sacar a sus hijos adelante.

El crédito sera utilizado para preparar la tierra y a la vez para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como abono, una bolsa de semilla, veneno, sulfato, para cultivar maíz.
texts.en: Maria is 49-year-old homemaker, who studied up to third grade. She is widowed, and her husband died many years ago. She has had to raise her two children alone, which has not been easy for her, and she has had to work hard in farming to provide for them. Maria grows corn and pipián (a type of squash), which her children help out with. Maria has worked in agriculture for a long time, and this work, which her father taught her how to do, has helped her a lot and enabled her to give her children a good life. She will use the loan to prepare the land and to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizer, a bag of seed, poison and sulfate in order to grow corn.

loans.use: to prepare the land for sowing corn and to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizer, a bag of seeds, poison and sulphate.

loans.name: M. Anwer

texts.en:
M. Anwer belongs to Lahore. He is married, and his wife looks after the house and their five children. He is a hardworking person. 

He owns a small dairy farm. This is the only source of income in the family. He sells milk locally and established himself well. He wants his business to become self-sustainable. 

The cowshed he currently has has deteriorated; also, the number of cows has increased. Therefore, he wants to rebuild it. For this he needs money, but his earnings are not significant enough to cover all the expenses, which is why he needs additional financing. He has therefore applied for a loan through BRAC Pakistan to get the financing required for building the cowshed. 

He is hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: to build a cowshed.

loans.name: Recy

texts.en:
Recy, 36,  has three children, aged 5, 7 and 12 years old. She operates a tricycle, locally known as a potpot (a vehicle that has three wheels and is moved by foot pedals). Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

Recy earns an income by transporting passengers from one place to another. In addition, she operates a sari-sari (a variety store). She sells items like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil and toiletries.  

Recy has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to purchase stock for her store and tires, etc., for tricycle maintenance. With these essential tools, she can improve her daily earnings.

Recy hopes that she will expand both businesses to finance the education of her children as well as provide them with nutritious diets.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store and tires, etc., for tricycle maintenence.

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.es:
Telma es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de dieciocho años y una bebé de ocho meses, y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es dinámica, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona sur de su ciudad; un sitio caracterizado por el comercio informal que agrupa a comerciantes de todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Telma es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Quechua que sólo habla con sus familiares, en el comercio se habla español mayormente (la primera de la derecha, agarrando su bebé). Su vida la comparte con su hijo que este año termina la escuela y su pequeña bebe que todavía usa pañales, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su necesidad por mejorar los ingresos para su familia la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de muebles, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas, confección de polleras, elaboración de empanadas y servicio de transporte, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus negocios. Su actividad principal es la venta de ropa; ella realiza la compra de ropa por mayor para venderla por unidad de forma ambulante en los comercios cercanos a su hogar, su segunda actividad es el servicio de limpieza de librería; esencialmente para mantener y preservar los libros, ya sea que los documentos sean antiguos o libros nuevos, el papel envejece naturalmente con el tiempo, pero el polvo, la grasa y los insectos se comen los materiales, destruyendo partes de la colección con el tiempo, mantener un ambiente limpio en la biblioteca es la mejor manera de conservar los libros por más tiempo. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en ocho años que viene realizando la misma labor. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa en su casa, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa por mayor para aprovechar la época de fin de año y generar mejores ingresos para los gastos de su bebé.
Es por esos motivos que Telma solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos alimenticios de su bebé.
texts.en:
Telma is 35 years old, single, with an 18 year old son and an 8 month old baby. Her business is selling clothing. She is dynamic, enterprising, reliable, responsible, and hard-working. She is a street vendor in the southern part of the city. This geographic area is known for its informal businesses where various vendors gather, for its tropical warm climate with an average temperature of 30 degrees centigrade all year round.

Telma has a dark complexion, long dark hair, her first language is Quechua which she speaks with her friends and family, and her second language Spanish which is what she uses for business. She is the first woman on the right holding on to the child. She shares her life with her son who completes school this year and her baby who is still in diapers. They live in a rented house with electricity and drinkable water. She needs to increase her family's income so she joined a bank with others who have businesses such as selling furniture, making leather wallets, selling quilts, making meat pies, making traditional clothing, making empanadas, and transportation services.The loan is so that they may continue in their businesses.

Telma's activity is selling clothing. She buys the clothing at wholesale to sell as a vendor in the markets near her home. Her second job is a cleaning service in a book store, essentially maintaining and preserving the book, as they are antique documents or new books, the books' paper naturally ages with time. However the dust, grease and insects eat the material, destroying parts of the collection over time. To maintain a clean environment in the library is the best way to conserve the books for a long time.

This is the third sequence of loans for the institution in 8 years that she is doing this work. Her dream is to have a clothing store in her home. She wants to make the wholesale clothing purchase to take advantage of the end of year season and generate greater income for her baby's expenses. For this reason Telma seeks a loan to buy clothing wholesale and with the earnings pay the good expenses of her baby.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale and with the benefits pay food expenses of her baby.

loans.name: Marquesa

texts.es: Compra de mercancia variada, como articulos de ferretería, bisutería, papelería, accesorios y variedades, fue en lo que invirtió Marquesa, con su anterior credikiva; ella estuvo muy satisfecha, por la tasa de interés preferencial ofrecida por Kiva y obtuvo mas utilidades para ampliar su negocio. En la actualidad cuenta con otro punto de ventas de ropa y calzado exclusivamente y esto le ha dado mas estabilidad a su vida. Marquesa dice en voz alta a sus financiadores " Gracias por su apoyo". Actualmente está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual aprovechará las festividades de navidad y de año nuevo, invirtiendo en ropa y calzado, pues ofrecerá lo que su clientela justamente necesita para esta época. Así se viven las fistas mas esperadas del año, que mantiene a las familias unidas y divirtiendose, mientras cantan, bailan y se abrazan, para celebrar las navidades, la despedida del año viejo, recibir al nuevo, bien vestidos, con la ropa y el calzado que compran en el negocio de Marquesa y entre sus manos con el aguinaldo que se entregaran entre si.
texts.en:
Marquesa used her last crediKiva to buy a variety of merchandise, such as hardware store goods, jewellery, stationary goods, accessories and knick-knacks. She was very satisfied with the preferential rate of interest that Kiva offered, and she gained more income to expand her business. She now has another sales branch, selling exclusively clothing and footwear, which has brought more stability to her life. Marquesa says out loud to her lenders "Thank you for your support".

She is now applying for another loan, which she will use to buy clothing and footwear, taking advantage of the upcoming Christmas and New Year festivities by offering her customers exactly what they need for this season. These are the most keenly awaited festivities of the year, which keep families united and entertained as they sing, dance and embrace to celebrate Christmas, say goodbye to the old year, and receive the new one. They will do all this well-dressed in the clothing and footwear that they buy from Marquesa's shop with their Christmas bonuses in hand.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Felix  Antonio

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre visionario y con deseos de seuperacion, es casado, obrero, trabaja de ayudante moliendo mateiales para la extracion de oro desde hace dos años con un hijo a su cargo al que le brinda todo el el apoyo para su formacion.
actualemte este señor tiene la necesidad de construir un cuarto en su vivienda para su hijo , ya que la vivienda solo cuenta con un dormitorio,, por eso se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que lo utilizaria en la compra de materiales de construccion tales como:ladrillo, cemento, arena, zinc, piedrin y madera. Felix se encuentra muy agradecido con ceprodel y con las  demas instituciones que hacen posible que se les opoye, ya que el ha obtenido once prestamos con este, y de esta manera ha hido mejorando su nivel y condiones de vida.-.
texts.en: Felix is a visionary man with the desire to be successful. He is married and works helping grind materials to extract gold. He has worked in this field for two years. He has a son and Felix provides him all the support he can for his education. Today Felix has the need to build a room in his home for his son, as the home only has one bedroom. Therefore he approached Ceprodel to seek financing that he will used to buy construction materials such as brick, cement, sand, stone, zinc and wood. Felix is very thankful to Ceprodel and with the other institution that provide him support, as he has obtained 11 loans and in this way he has improved his quality of life and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as brick, cement, sand, stone, zinc and wood.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi âgée de 43ans pour se prendre en charge revend des casseroles et plats de façon ambulante à KPALIME. Elle demande un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandises. A l'avenir, Afi veut étendre son activité et assurer le bien - être des membres de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi, 43 years of age, makes a living reselling pots and plates as an ambulant vendor in Kpalime. She is applying for her first loan in order to stock up on merchandise. In the future, Avi would like to expand her business and provide for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy plates and pots [for resale].

loans.name: Ana Santos

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad es una mujer que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 22 y 20 años de edad como madre soltera. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza cada día dando lo mejor de sí en su trabajo como cocinera en un restaurante ya que sabe que es de este, que depende para llevar el sustento diario para sus hijos, aunque uno de sus hijos le da apoyo en la economía de su hogar por lo que se siente muy feliz. Ana a base de esfuerzos y apoyada con su hijo ha logrado construir un cuarto, pero no le alcanzo para colocarle techo, es por ello que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para colocar techo a un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana, age 40, is a woman who, as a single mother, has been able to help her two children, ages 22 and 20, get ahead.  She is a woman who makes an effort every day to give the best of herself in her work as a restaurant cook, since she knows that she depends on that to bring daily sustenance to her children, although one of her children supports the household economy, for which she is very happy.  Based on her efforts and supported by her son, Ana has been able to build a room, but she doesn't have enough to give it a roof.  For that reason, she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, beams, and fasteners to put a roof on a room of her house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, beams, and fasteners to put a roof on a room of her house.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en: Bashiran is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shop situated in the vehicle spare parts market. It is challenging for him to sell his product with his competitors. This competition highly affects his daily sales. To grow his business and income, and to differentiate his business from the competitors, he decided to offer additional and stylish spare parts. He hopes that this strategy will have positive results and that customers will be attracted to his new products. He cannot act upon his strategy without some capital. Therefore his wife, Bashiran, requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because BRAC Pakistan provides the facility to empower the poor. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her husband's shop

loans.name: Aishakan

texts.ru: Айшакан 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Айшакан - среднее образование, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айшакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 6 коров, также есть 0,7 ГА поливной земли, где Айшакан выращивает арбузы, хлопок и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Экологически чистая и вкусная сельскохозяйственная продукция Айшакан пользуется большим спросом, принося ежемесячный доход около 22,000 сом (KGS). В этом году Айшакан решила отремонтировать свой дом, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку цемента, досок и прочих материалов. Айшакан является членом группы "Нурэл", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от ведения бизнеса помогут Айшакан увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Aishakan is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four. Aishakan has received secondary education. Since 2000 she has been raising livestock and growing farm produce. Thanks to Aishakan's hard work, she has six cows at her farm at present. She also has 0.7 [2.5 acres] of irrigated land, where she grows watermelons, cotton and corn for own consumption as well as for sale. Aishakan's ecologically grown and delicious produce is in high demand and brings in a monthly income of approximately 22,000 KGS. This year Aishakan has decided to renovate her house, which is why she applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in teh amount of 50,000 KGS to buy cement, wood planks and other materials. Aishakan is a member of the Nurel borrowers' group, which has two additional members. The income from her business will allow Aishakan to increase her livestock headocunt.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the renovation of her house.

loans.name: A.p.p V.e.s Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mary   de 43 años de edad  madre de 1 hijo  y casada, tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza  ya hace un 1 año.la Sra. Mary a través de sus esfuerzos ha ido captando  clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes  y así poder salir adelante. A la vez la Sra.  Mary  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada.   Mary es la única señora que se encuentra parada, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old, married and the mother to a son.  She has a small business selling beauty products, which she has run for the past year.  Through her effort, she has been able to attract customers, which have generated earnings for her to cover her household expenses.  In the future, she would like to have her own retail space where she can sell her products and earn larger profits.

With the loan, she will purchase more beauty products for her business so that she can continue satisfying the needs of her customers and get ahead.  Mary and the other members of the group are grateful for Kiva for the loan they are giving them and for the confidence that they have instilled in them.  In the picture, Mary is the only woman standing.  She signs off with the promise that she will achieve all of her goals.

loans.use: purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a new septic system as the one he current has is full of waste, cannot hold more, is unsightly and not hygienic.

loans.name: Juan Baustista

texts.es:
El señor Juan Bautista de 42  años de edad, vive con su esposa,  tiene dos  hijos  que dependen de él, vive San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante,  sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato, ya que les ofrece a sus clientes la ropa que necesitan en su casa porque el sale a vender en su motocicleta a las aldeas y barrios aledaños a su comunidad.
Don Juan es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, calzonetas, etc. tiene varios pedidos de ropa para la época de la navidad y con el apoyo del préstamo espera suplir sus necesidades de financiamiento y a su vez mejorar un poco su calidad de vida, es un buen cliente que desea  seguir trabajando con Prisma es su cuarto crédito que solícita. 
 Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

 San Lorenzo- Honduras- Octubre del 2014.
texts.en: Juan Bautista, who is 42 years old, lives with his wife and has two children who are dependent on him. He lives in San Lorenzo, which is in the Valle region in the south of Honduras.
