Rogelio Jr is a merchant and fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He runs a small sari-sari (variety store), selling various kinds of goods and items to the people in his place. He is also engaged in a fishing business, which provides him an additional income.

Rogelio Jr is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. A loan will help him improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Rogelio Jr hopes to make his business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Lyka

texts.en:
This is Lyka, 19, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is single and she is helping her family meet their needs. At this time, she is working hard to improve her income from her business. Lyka offers massage services. She offers whole body massage while selling soap products to her clients. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
 
Lyka wants to expand soon for she hopes to become successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her massage business and to buy soap products that she sells.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 44 years old and married. She has two children who are in school, and Janet works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Janet has been in this business for four years.

In the future Janet would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana de 61 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, de 38, 37, 33,30 y 22 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 2° grado de educación básica actualmente vive con sus nietos.

Ana es comerciante, tiene una tienda en la que vende artículos de primera necesidad, tomo la decisión de dedicarse a esto porque tenia 5 hijos pequeños y tenia que ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para abastecer la tienda, granos básicos, productos de higiene personal, condimentos especias y productos de cocina, bebidas entre otros para no perder clientes por no tener lo que buscan.

Ana espera seg8uir trabajando y dar una buena educación a sus nietos, mientras Dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 61 years old, is a widow with 5 children, 38, 37, 33, 30 and 22 years old.  She could only study up to 2nd grade of primary school.  Currently she lives with her grandchildren.

Ana is a merchant, and has a general store that sells staples.  She made the decision to pursue this business because she had 5 small children and had to help her partner with the household expenses.

She needs the loan to purchase merchandise to supply the store with basic grains, personal hygiene products, spices, seasonings and cooking products, beverages among others, in order not to lose customers by not having what they seek.

Ana hopes to continue working and provide a good education for her grandchildren, as long as God grants her life.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, personal hygiene products, spices, seasonings and cooking products, beverages  among others.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Conchita earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Conchita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Conchita dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 50 years old. She is a mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store and some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well.

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Bushra requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Bushra thank to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's general store by buying more wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a businesswoman from Liloy. She is married and has expertise in selling. Ana runs a little sari-sari (general) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Ana is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without a record of default.

Now, Ana has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Ana continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is 48 years old and happily married to Arnie. God has blessed them with children who are studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Jocelyn owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community, where the store is just connected to, or just inside, their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Jocelyn desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping to give her children all their needs, particularly in their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 28 years old with one child. Nelita works very hard to provide for their daily needs.

Nelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Nelita has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, tomato sauce, and biscuits.

In the future, Nelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Kagando Teachers Group

texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old and married with five children. He is a member of Kagando Teachers Group, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Joel is a poultry farmer who sells eggs and he also earns a salary as a side income, since he is a teacher by profession. He began the poultry business in order to pay the school fees of his children. Joel has a dream of expanding his business, however, he is faced with the challenge of competition. Joel wants money to buy poultry feed. Joel appreciates Kiva's work.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Esquejes, abonos, e insumos son los productos por los que señor José de 40 años de edad quiere solicitar un crédito, tiene un cultivo de flores con una vista prodigiosa hacia las sabanas verdes que rodean a Antioquia, la suma del préstamo es considerando el alto costos de los insumos agrícolas ya que tiene un terreno extenso donde cultiva las hermosas flores que podemos apreciar en las fotos.
Dichos insumos son de vital importancia en cada cultivo y es que estos les permiten nacer sanas y fuertes y pelechar, por lo que es un gasto necesario que tiene que hacer y que hoy recurre al microcrédito al no tener capital para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Cuttings [flower sprouts], fertilizers, and other supplies are the needs that 40-year-old José wants to cover with this loan. He has a flower farm with an impressive view over the green expanses that surround Antioquia.

The amount of the loan takes into account the high costs of agricultural supplies and the extensive piece of property where he grows the beautiful flowers that we can admire in the photo.

These supplies are vitally important to each plant and are what allow them to be born healthy and strong and prosper. It is a necessary expense that he must make, so he is turning to a microloan because he doesn't have the capital to do it alone.

loans.use: to purchase supplies: fertilizers and flower cuttings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to apply for the processing of her university diploma.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build another latrine in a vacant lot of his property, because the one he has is in bad condition.

loans.name: M. Shakeel

texts.en:
M. Shakeel, 48, lives in Lahore. He is married and has five children. All his children go to school. Given his big family, he has a lot of expenses to cover. 

He has a general store and 12 years of experience in this business. Most of his time is spent at his shop. 

He currently wants to buy more inventory to avoid any stock shortages. He has therefore requested a loan to help him buy the necessary inventory. 

He wants to provide his children with higher level studies and is hopeful for their bright future.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his general store.

loans.name: Qayyum

texts.en:
Qayyum, age 40, is a housewife. She adores her family. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Qayyum is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's scrap business. He will use the loan to purchase scrap iron, aluminium, and plastic bottles for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Qayyum hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's scrap business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 48 years old and married with four children; all of her children are in school, Perlita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, biscuits, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soap, candies, etc. In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, biscuits, shampoo, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing boat and a fish net. Helen has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and a fish net for her fishing activity.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is fifty-four years old, and married with eleven children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise and also practices farming growing crops such as maize, beans, rice and others to get additional income to earn a living. Julius has a dream of expanding into a wholesale business. However, he is faced with a challenge of high transport costs and competition. Julius wants money to buy sugar, soft drinks, soap, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, soap, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Vipaji Group

texts.en:
Ramadhan is a married, 50-year-old man with four children, one of whom is in school. He has been running a business selling bricks for two years now. He works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ramadhan's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy an advanced brick-making machine, a lorry of sand, sacks of cement, and water for making better bricks. He has successfully repaid his loans. He is doing fine with the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sand, cement and a tank of water for making more bricks to sell. He dreams of making a good number of bricks and taking his children to good schools.

Ramadhan will share this loan with his loan group, Vipaji Group, which has a total of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and  a tank of water for making bricks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: To have an additional source of income, Betty has been engaged in buying and reselling scrap materials within her community. She is 51 years old and has eight children. Two of them are still studying at the secondary level. She wants to buy more stocks of scrap materials to resell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail an additional source of income of PHP 7,000 to buy the additional scrap materials to sell. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve this business someday.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to resell for her retail business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years. She is married to Paul and together they have been blessed with five children aged between 22 and 10 years. Paul is a farmer; hence, he provides additional income for his family. Elsa sells vegetables and cereals, a business she has operated for the last 13 years; she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Elsa has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 10,000, which she will use to add assorted vegetables as well as cereals for resale at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to have a stable source of income and business that will ensure her children are educated for life.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is a married 33-year-old woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Celerina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Celerina has been raising livestock for four years and has borrowed six times from NWTF in the past to sustain it. In the future, Celerina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 54 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, juice sachets, soap, candles, sandwich spreads, etc. In the future, Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Florence has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. Florence husband, Victor, manages their small farm making $100 per year. Even though his small income keeps the family living in poverty, he still claims the position of breadwinner in the household, as is the case in most households in Kenya.

Financial support far outweighs any other care or support for the family, leaving women disadvantaged to make decisions within the household, and forces them to fully depend on their husbands to buy everything, from laundry soap to the food they eat. Until this cultural dogma shifts, it is critical that women have opportunities to participate in money-making activities. 

With the little time Florence has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. From Kiva lenders, Florence is seeking a loan worth 120,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Florence access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Florence’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of a five-month-old child. She is from Ajuy, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.

Janet is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With a loan, they will be able to improve their fishing business, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Janet hopes to make their fishing business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz sends you her gratitude for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery items which are needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her two children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 18,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and other products for her to sell. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase on sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Paz wants to see her children finish their college degrees. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and other products, to add to her inventory for her general store business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 53 years old and married with one child. Violeta works very hard to provide for their daily needs. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, shampoo, etc. Violeta has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, soap, toothpaste, bread, etc. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, shampoo, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en: Genesa is 36 years old and married.  She is in agriculture, fattening pigs in the Philippines for the past five years. Genesa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  Genesa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 50 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Delfina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer. Delfina has been farming bananas for 27 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 55 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as toothpaste, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, candies, etc. to sell.

Bonifacia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, candies, etc. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as toothpaste, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sherryl

texts.en: Sherryl is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Sherryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Flordelisa

texts.en:
Maria Flordelisa is 35 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Maria Flordelisa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Flordelisa has been in pig fattening for 10 years and earns additional income from hat and basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Abdul Ghafoor

texts.en:
Abdul runs a general store in a small community in Lahore. He is 34, married and a father of five children. He is a loving father and makes sure to provide his family with the best. He has many years of experience running the general store and has a good customer base. He wants to restock the inventory of goods at his general store so that sales are not disrupted. He has, therefore, requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to arrange for the financing.
 
He is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To restock inventories at his General Store.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 60 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc to sell.

Haide has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Haide aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with three children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Aida has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 33 years.

Aida aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Merly

texts.en:
Ma. Merly is 52 years old and has eight children. She is married and three of her children are still in school.

Ma. Merly is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Ma. Merly has been in pig fattening for four years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 43 years old and from Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband works as a furniture painter while she operates their sari sari (variety) store. 

Even though they are earning, it is sometimes not enough, especially since they are sending their son Roy Vincent to college. Roy is taking up a B.S. in Accountancy. He wants to finish his studies because he believes that those with proper education and training get a higher income, which means he can easily give back to his parents. 

So to help sustain his schooling, Jennifer wants to seek a 200,000 Philippines pesos education loan from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 41 years old now.

Dolores has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dolores has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her business.

Roselyn has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Ethelyn

texts.en:
Ethelyn is 58 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ethelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ethelyn has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Reulita

texts.en:
Managing a retail store is the primary activity of Reulita within her community. She is 52 years old and has only one child attending school. Together with her husband, they aspire to become successful and financially stable to give their child a bright future. 

To further improve her business, she would like to access additional capital of 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of soft drinks, laundry soaps, shampoos, noodles, canned goods, assorted candies, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and frozen foods to resell. She hopes that she will receive her requested amount to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, laundry soaps, shampoos, noodles, canned goods, assorted candies, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and frozen foods to resell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has a carpentry business in Nakuru town and has been running this business for four years now. He makes sofa sets, wall units, beds and chairs. He is 27 years old, married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of timber, textile materials and nails for making more sofa sets and chairs. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his business. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, he hopes to have a successful business and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber and nails for use in his business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Wilma has been in this business for 22 years now.

Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Bernadith works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Bernadith is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Bernadith has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Raynalyn

texts.en:
Raynalyn is 33 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a married woman.

Raynalyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Raynalyn has been pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en: Sabra is a 45-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges at his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Sabra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase more variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Sabra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC. Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Jane, who is in her mid 30s, is single with one kid who is still in school. She has been running a charcoal business for three years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jane's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the charcoal stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She is doing fine with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of being able to buy the whole lorry of charcoal herself.  

Jane will share this loan with her loan group "Tupendane C," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosita is 60 years old now.

Rosita has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Rosita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: 180001.tt Quán Lào Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy has a retail business selling stationery items.  Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stationery (books, notebooks, pens) to resell.

Thúy is 33 years old, and she is married with no children. Thúy is the group leader of the 180001.TT Quán Lào solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery (books, notebooks, pens) to resell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and married with one child. She has been a wholesaler of bananas in their town for almost 10 years. From this long time of experience in selling, she already has high knowledge in dealing this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Evangeline still gets more customers above the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

For now, Evangeline has a small stall and sells banana cue as her sideline business, and she is planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business, which is creating a small pigpen for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 100 kilos of bananas for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kilos of bananas for wholesale

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a responsible mother of two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Yasmeen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Yasmeen also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the expense of repairing her husband's taxi

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly is 48 years old, married and lives in Liloy Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to build a concrete pig pen. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Nhóm 6 Thôn 4 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mai is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children. Mai is the group leader of the Nhóm 6 thôn 4 Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Mrs Mai works in agriculture raising poultry. Mai has been involved in this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2010, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mai has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 46 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, can goods, etc.

Angelita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and food and vegetable vending.

Angelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Hello, lenders. Meet Ruth. She is a 30-year-old farmer from Kapomboi village, situated in the Kitale area of Kenya. She lives together with her husband and four children on a small piece of land where she keeps poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. For ten years, her primary sources of income have been eggs and horticultural produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Ruth made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities. Some time last month, she applied for a loan for expanding her horticulture farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to her children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Ruth’s children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: 010001.tt Quán Lào Group

texts.en:
Thời is 34 years old and is married with one child. Thời is the group leader of the 010001.tt Quán Lào Group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thời has a retail business selling cakes, salt, sweets, and sugar in her general store. Thời has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, salt, sweets, sugar, and other items to resell. This is Thời's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thời hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cakes, salt, sweets, sugar, and other items to resell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel tiene 50 años de edad y posee un taller de calzado, repara y elabora calzado, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Manuel vive en casa propia con su esposa,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 50 years old and runs a shoe workshop where he makes and repairs shoes. He runs his workshop from home and has many clients due to the quality of his products. With his sales he has been able to cover the household costs that come up. He lives in his own home with his wife.

Manuel is applying for a loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc. to continue making shoes since that is his only source of income. This loan will provide him and his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc.

loans.name: 050002.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mr. Lực has a retail business selling mats. He is requesting a loan to purchase more mats to resell.

Lực is 26 years old and married with one child.

Lực is the group leader of the 050002.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of four members. He lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Lực's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. He has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns him is the lack of capital.

With his business profit,  Lực hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more mats to resell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  

Judith is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Judith has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer. Judith has been farming corn for 22 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Melquecidez

texts.es: Desde el año 2010, Melquecideth de 41 años de edad, se dedica a la fabricación de sandalias y calzado femenino en general;  esta decisión la tomó  cuando realizó un curso técnico de calzado femenino en una institución especializada en formación  técnica y tecnológica del país  (SENA) en la cual aprendió también, a emprender su propia aventura de negocios, con el conocimiento que había adquirido. Sus principales clientes son comerciantes mayoristas particulares, a  quienes les trabaja sobre medidas. Las ventas de Melquecidez las realiza a crédito y de contado, durante todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, comprando sus materias primas en almacenes especializados, para obtener buenos precios y ser más competitivo. Su meta más adelante es comprar maquinarias y lograr genera empleos, con el fin de ampliar su cobertura y generar más utilidades, para en un futuro remodelar su vivienda. Su mayor desafío, es incrementar la producción y lograr conseguir nuevos clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, como suelas, sintéticos, pegante y accesorios. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará en tanto a que sus ventas se incrementarán con los nuevos diseños, pues los ajustará a la temporada más comercial del año, el mes de Diciembre, fecha en la que se celebran las navidades y el año nuevo;  en esta bella época  todos quieren usar calzado nuevo, que los haga ver mas elegantes y sentirse feliz al lado de su familia con la que celebraran el nacimiento de Jesus y la despedida del año 2014.
texts.en:
Since 2010, Melquecidez, 41, has been making sandals and women's shoes in general.  He decided on this trade after taking a technical course in women's shoes at a national insitute specializing in technical and technological training (SENA).  He also learned about starting his own business with the knowledge he had acquired.  His main customers are wholesale merchants for whom he works based on measurements.

Melquecidez sells on credit and on a cash basis.  Througout the year he works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and buys raw materials in specialist shops so he can pay less and be more competitive.  His goal for the future is to buy machinery and generate employment.  This is so he can broaden his market and earn more profit in order to renovate his house in the future.

His greatest challenge is to increase production and attract new customers.  He is requesting a CrediKiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy raw materials such as as soles, synthetic materials, glue and accessories.  This investment will increase his sales volume through new designs for the busiest season of the year in December: Christmas and New Year's.  During this wonderful time of year everyone wants new shoes to feel more elegant and happy alongside their families, celebrating the birth of Jesus and saying goodbye to 2014.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as soles, synthetic material, glue and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the family house

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 48 years. She is married to John and together they have been blessed with four children between the ages of 14 and 6 years old. John is a businessman who provides additional income for his family.

Eunice sells second hand clothing, a business she has done for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 25,000. 

Eunice has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kes 20,000, which she will use to add new bales of used clothing to her stock.

With the anticipated profits, Eunice will be able to pay school fees for her children as well as add new stock.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable source of income and business, which will ensure her children are educated for life.

loans.use: to buy new bales of used clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilou successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Marilou's business profile again for funding another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy banana, rice, flour, meat, etc.

loans.name: Filis

texts.en:
Filiz is from the southern part of Kosovo. At 33 years old, she is recently married and now the mother of 6-month-old twins. She is not able to work currently because she is busy taking care of her babies. The main source of income is from her husband, who works selling kebabs. Her husband has tried several times to save money to renovate their home, which is very old and in poor condition, but has not been successful. 

Filiz is requesting a loan to renovate their home, as she feels that it is unsanitary and unacceptable to raise her babies in. She hopes that this loan will help to improve their living conditions and to provide a better life for her children. She promises to pay on time and hopes that she will be able to start work in the near future.

loans.use: To renovate her home

loans.name: Sherife

texts.en:
Sherife is 34 years old, single and very hardworking. She lives with her mother. She is employed in a factory as a seamstress and she also sews handicrafts that she sells from her home. When Sherife is finished with her shift at work, she comes home and starts on her orders from her customers. She really enjoys being able to satisfy her customers with the quality of her work. 

She hopes in the future to be able to expand her business and to have it be her sole source of income. For the first time, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 EUR in order to purchase materials for her business. She hopes that this will allow her to provide better quality and more selection to her customers, giving her even more business and income.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is 37 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Anna Marie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for four years and earns additional income from fishing and buying and selling rice.

Anna Marie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gunel

texts.en:
Gunel is 23 year old, married and she has a son. Gunel is an IDP (internally displaced person) and she lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. The main source of income for her family is raising and selling seasonal vegetables (cucumbers, onions, greens, etc.). This brings her 180 AZN monthly but she gets additional earnings from working as a tailor in her free time.

Raising vegetables is very popular in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for fresh vegetables. They use these products to prepare delicious fresh salads and national dishes. 

Gunel’s husband is ill and he needs good care but this isn’t possible with her small income. So Gunel wants to increase productivity and income and provide her husband with a good life, because it’s very hard for refugees to pay for medicines. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to buy new good fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy new good fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lay manure on his cacao crops.

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
Ma. Nelly works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from passenger transportation. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Miledys

texts.es:
Mileidys es una joven muy sonriente de 24 años de edad que dedica parte de su vida a la venta de mercancía como celulares y artículos de venta por catálogo, con este negocio puede mantener a su hijo de 2 años de edad y le ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
Mileidys inicio este negocio como una alternativa para apoyar el déficit económico por el que atraviesa su familia y en vista de los buenos resultados por su buena labor de vendedora quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de vitrinas y exhibir sus productos en su hogar. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá tener mayor existencias de productos y un punto de venta en el cual los clientes pueden volver a buscarla para solicitarle un producto nuevo por lo que se encuentra muy feliz y es un reto para ella seguir trabajando hasta conseguir un local comercial y vender cómodamente.
texts.en:
Mileidys is a very smiley young woman of 24 years of age who spends part of her life selling products such as mobile phones and items from a catalogue. With this business she is able to bring up her two year old son and help her husband with the household costs.

Mileidys began this business as an alternative income stream to support her family who were suffering from a lack of funds. After seeing the great results from her good work as a vendor, Mileidys decided to apply for a loan to buy display cabinets to display her products in her home. 

With the help of this loan Mileidys will be able to have a wider range of stock and a point of sale where her clients can come to her to ask for new products. She is very happy about this and for her it is a challenge to continue working until she can have her own store where she can make sales comfortably.

loans.use: to buy two display cabinets to display her products from the comfort of her own home

loans.name: Franklin Jehovany

texts.es:
Franklin de 20 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato sus padres tomaron la decisión de que mejor empezara a trabajar y dejara sus estudios, por lo que empezó desde muy joven. 

Franklin es comerciante, tiene 5 años de administrar un pequeño negocio de comida rápida, aprendió de sus padres que se dedicaron a este tipo de venta y que ahora es la fuente principal de ingresos de Franklin.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una estufa nueva y utensilios para la cocina, su negocio continuo creciendo y necesita cubrir ciertas necesidades.

Franklin espera tener un negocio bien equipado para agilizar los pedidos de sus clientes, también espera comprar una motocicleta per dar servicio a domicilio.
texts.en:
Franklin, 20, is single and has no children.  He has a high school education but did not continue because his parents decided it was better that he start working from a young age.

Franklin is a merchant and has been running a fast food business for five years.  He learned from his parents who are in the same type of business, so it has become Franklin's main source of income.

The loan will be used to buy a new stove and utensils for the kitchen.  His business continues to grow and he needs to cover certain needs.

Franklin wants to have a well-equipped business so he can speed up customer orders.  He also wants to buy a motorcycle and provide a home delivery service.

loans.use: To buy a new stove and utensils for his kitchen.

loans.name: Mario Adalberto

texts.es:
Mario de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tienen una hija que aún no estudian.

Actualmente Mario es motorista de una ruta de bus, y tiene 1 año laborando, antes trabajaba en una fábrica de bloque, su horario de trabajo es de 5:30 am a 5 pm, además tiene un carro donde realiza viajes a la cuidad.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar un coche de venta y venderán más que todo hamburguesas, papas fritas, hot dog y bebidas. El negocio lo manejara su pareja y otra parte lo necesita para hacerle un ajuste a la culata del carro que nada fallando. 

El sueño de él es que el negocio a montar les dé resultado y que funcione así con las ganancias invertirles para hacerlo más grande, y seguir trabajando para pagar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mario is 21 years old and has a sixth-grade education. He has a partner who makes a living selling tortillas. The couple has a daughter who is not yet in school.

Mario currently makes a living as a bus driver. He has been doing this work for one year, having previously worked in a brick factory. Mario works from 5.30am until 5pm. He has a vehicle for driving to the city.

This loan will be used to buy a food cart and to sell mainly hamburgers, hot-dogs, chips and beverages. This business will be managed by Mario's partner. Part of the loan will also be used to maintain Mario's vehicle, to ensure it is in full working order.

Mario's dream is for this new business to be a success and to use the profits to re-invest and expand the business. He wants to continue working in order to pay household costs.

loans.use: to buy a food cart and sell mainly hamburgers, hot-dogs, chips and beverages.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Hương is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hương is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Saycy

texts.en:
Saycy is 37 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Saycy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Saycy has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Saycy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 48 and the mother of two children living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables and fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables and fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable and fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. Therefore, Khalida has asked for a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable and fruit sales business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be resilient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are women. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be importing clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and also be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Lorma

texts.en:
Lorma is 57 years old and single and works very hard to help her parents.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lorma has been in this business for 28 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Agustina has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn 5 Đb -Quảng Vinh Group

texts.en:
Lệ is 60 years old and she is married with three children. She works in agriculture. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lệ is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn 5 ĐB -Quảng Vinh solidarity group, which consists of five members.

In 2014, Lệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rock Of Joy School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Gladys. She is the Head teacher of Rock of Joy Nursery & Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Lungujja in Kampala district with 384 students. Rock of Joy Nursery & Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Rock of Joy Nursery & Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Gladys ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kasubi Modern School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ramzy. He is the Head teacher of Kasubi Modern Islamic Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kasubi in Kampala district with 385 students. Kasubi Modern Islamic Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kasubi Modern School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ramzy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Good Times School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Edmond. He is the Principal of Good Times Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Mpererwe in Kampala district with 400 students. Good Times Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Good Times School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Edmond ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposa es comerciante, administra una tienda y vende productos por catálogos,  solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

José es agricultor desde los 15 años de edad, aprendió de sus padres cuando les ayudaba en las tareas agrícolas, también hace trabajos de albañilería por contratos. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para la tienda como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, papel higiénico, aceites, pasta dental, bebidas, golosinas y demás, para mantener abastecida la tienda.

Una de las proyecciones más importantes de José es comprar un vehículo para movilizarse y trasladar sus herramientas de trabajo, también para comprar la mercadería para la tienda.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and lives with his partner and two children. His children are studying at the local school, and his wife is a shopkeeper - she manages a shop and sells products via catalogues. 

José has been a farmer since he was 15 years old, and he was taught by his parents while he helped them on the farm. He also undertakes work as a bricklayer, on a contractual basis. The loan is needed to buy merchandise to stock the shop, such as rice, beans, sugar, toilet paper, oils, toothpaste, drinks, snacks, etc.

One of José's most important plans for the future is to buy a vehicle to enable him to get around and transport his work tools, as well as to buy the merchandise for the shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, toilet paper, oils, toothpaste, drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Margarita Reina

texts.es: Doña Margarita vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida en el mercado municipal desde hace vario años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas y mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú, pero no cuenta con capital suficiente para esta inversión, es por eso solicita un crédito  para poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Margarita lives with her husband and three children in a house of her own. She has been selling food at the local marketplace for some years now and uses the profits to cover the home expenses.

Margarita wants to expand her business. She will buy tables, chairs and more ingredients to diversify her menu, e.g. rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruits and vegetables. However, she does not have enough money for this, so she is requesting a loan to buy what she needs and increase her profits in order to reach financial stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients to diversify her menu, such as rice, chicken, beans and fruits.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús de 55 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos dos asisten a la escuela y dos todavía no cumplen la edad para asistir. Su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Jesús es agricultor, tiene 40 años de experiencia, aprendió de sus padres quienes también cultivaban granos básicos como el maíz y el frijol. También es comerciante de granos básicos.
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz y frijol para comerciar y comprar fertilizante, pesticidas y herbicidas para terminare sus trabajos agrícolas.

Jesús espera iniciar el otro año y empezar a cultivar hortalizas, ha recibido una serie de capacitaciones y quiere ponerlas en práctica.
texts.en:
Jesús is 55 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Two of them are in school and two of them aren't old enough to go yet. His spouse is a housewife and only and and their children live with him. 

Jesus is a farmer. He has 40 years' experience. He learned from his parents who also grew basic grains such as corn and beans. He also is a basic grains merchant. The loan will be used to buy corn and beans to sell and to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to finish his agricultural work. 

Jesús hopes to start another year and begin growing vegetables. He has received a series of trainings and he wants to put them in practice.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell as well as fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijas de 1 y 3 años de edad, él estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su esposa es comerciante y tiene un negocio en el que vende pupusas, solo ella y sus hijas viven con él.

José realiza diversas actividades, es pescador artesanal y agricultor, cosa que aprendió de sus padres, cultiva 7,000 mts cuadrados de maíz, ambas actividades las aprendió de sus padres; tiene 5 años de ser el pastor de la iglesia de su comunidad y también da clases de música a los jóvenes de la iglesia.

El préstamo será utilizado para mejorar el negocio de su esposa, quiere pagar la conexión de la luz en su casa que por el momento les pasa la energía un vecino y con esto mejorar el servicio que se ofrece a los clientes. El sueño de José es mantener siempre a su familia y que no les falte nada, también mejorar su casa para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old. He is married and has 2 daughters, 1 and 3 years old. He went to school through the 9th grade. His wife is a merchant and her a business where she sells pupusas. Only she and their daughters live with him. 

José does different activities. He is an artisanal fisherman and farmer. He learned this from his parents. He grows 7,000 sq. mts.  of corn. He learned both activities from his parents. He has been a pastor in a community church for 5 years and he also teaches music classes to the young people in the church.  

The loan will be used to improve his wife's business. He wants to pay for the electricity connection in his house. At this time, they get energy from their neighbor. With this, the service she offers the customers will improve. Jose's dream is to always support his family and for them to lack for nothing. He also wants to improve his home so they can live better.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity connection in his house.
